{{Use British English|date=October 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jordan Pickford | image = Jordan Pickford 2018 (cropped).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Pickford playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Jordan Lee Pickford<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_name = Jordan Lee Logan<ref name=englandfootballonline>{{cite web |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/TeamPlyrsBios/PlayersP/BioPickfordJL.html |title=Jordan Pickford |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |accessdate=17 June 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|3|7|df=y}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/jordan-pickford-236512/ |title=Jordan Pickford |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=18 May 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Washington, Tyne and Wear|Washington]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4640/Jordan-Pickford/overview |title=Jordan Pickford: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1 = 2002–2011 | youthclubs1 = [[Sunderland A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Sunderland]] | years1 = 2011–2017 | clubs1 = [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] | caps1 = 31 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] (loan) | caps2 = 17 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013 | clubs3 = → [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]] (loan) | caps3 = 12 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2013 | clubs4 = → [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] (loan) | caps4 = 12 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2014 | clubs5 = → [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] (loan) | caps5 = 18 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2014–2015 | clubs6 = → [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] (loan) | caps6 = 33 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2015–2016 | clubs7 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) | caps7 = 24 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2017– | clubs8 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps8 = 69 | goals8 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 17 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2015 | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 3 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam6 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 14 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2017– | nationalteam7 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps7 = 16 | nationalgoals7 = 0 | club-update = 23:48, 22 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:48, 22 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jordan Lee Pickford''' (''[[Name at birth|né]]'' '''Logan'''; born 7 March 1994)<ref name=englandfootballonline/> is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]].
Pickford has previously played for Sunderland's academy, reserve, and senior teams in addition to [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spells at [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]], [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]], [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]], [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] and [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]]. He signed for Everton for a fee of £25 million in June 2017.
Pickford has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He received his first call-up from the full [[England national football team|England]] national team for the 2018 World Cup qualifier against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in October 2016, making his debut in November 2017 in a friendly against [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. He was the starting goalkeeper in England’s 2018 World Cup fourth-place finish, leading the squad to its first semi-final appearance since 1990 with a penalty shootout victory in the second round and a clean sheet in the quarter-final.
==Early and personal life== Pickford was born in [[Washington, Tyne and Wear]],<ref>{{Hugman|26312|accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> and attended [[St Robert of Newminster Catholic School]].<ref name="SEcho_Nov2016">{{cite news |last=Wheeler |first=Katy |title=Hundreds turn up to Sunderland players' Christmas signing session |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/lifestyle/hundreds-turn-up-to-sunderland-players-christmas-signing-session-1-8262680 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=13 June 2017}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Sunderland=== Pickford joined [[Sunderland A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Sunderland's Academy]] at the age of eight and progressed through the age groups before signing two-year scholarship terms in 2010.<ref name="skysports.com">{{cite news |last=Charles |first=Andy |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11695/10144727/sunderland-goalkeeper-jordan-pickford-signs-new-contract |title=Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford signs new contract |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 January 2016 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> The following year, Pickford was promoted from the Academy to the reserve team.<ref>{{cite news |title=Black Cats boss has keeper dilemma |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/9080459.Black_Cats_boss_has_keeper_dilemma/ |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=13 June 2011 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
In 2011, Pickford signed his first professional contract with the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Poyet still wants Sunderland back-up, despite Pickford deal |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/football/sunderland-afc/poyet-still-wants-sunderland-back-up-despite-pickford-deal-1-6648325 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |date=2 June 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> The following year, Pickford signed a contract extension with the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland sign up two players to their youth system |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sunderland-sign-up-two-players-1367457 |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle upon Tyne |date=8 June 2012 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
====Loans to Darlington and Alfreton Town==== Pickford signed on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for [[Conference Premier]] club [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] in time to make his debut against [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] on 21 January 2012, playing the whole of a 1–0 home loss.<ref>{{cite news |title=Keeper Jordan Pickford signs as the region rallies round Darlington FC |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/keeper-jordan-pickford-signs-region-3677528 |newspaper=Teesside Gazette |location=Middlesbrough |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Match Report: Darlington 0–1 Fleetwood Town |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/darlington-0-fleetwood-town-1-1343033 |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle upon Tyne |date=22 January 2012 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> The initial month-long loan was subsequently extended until the end of April.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford extends Darlington loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17105108 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 February 2012 |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> Pickford went on to make seventeen appearances for Darlington,<ref name=Soccerway/> who were relegated.<ref>{{Cite web |title=A Brief History of Darlington FC |url=http://darlingtonfootballclub.co.uk/history/brief-history/ |publisher=Darlington F.C. |accessdate=14 November 2017}}</ref>
On 25 February 2013, Pickford signed for Conference Premier club [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]], again on an initial month-long loan<ref>{{cite news |title=Alfreton Town sign Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21579193 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> and was a cover for [[Phil Barnes]], who was injured.<ref>{{cite news |title=Pickford moves in to help Alfreton Town with Barnes out |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-moves-help-alfreton-barnes/story-18256218-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=25 February 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017190852/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-moves-help-alfreton-barnes/story-18256218-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> He made his debut the next day in a 5–1 win over [[Hyde United F.C.|Hyde United]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tomlinson hits hat-trick as Alfreton Town crush Hyde United |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/tomlinson-hits-hat-trick-alfreton-town-crush-hyde/story-18265198-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=26 February 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017191229/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/tomlinson-hits-hat-trick-alfreton-town-crush-hyde/story-18265198-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> His loan spell at the club was subsequently extended until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Alfreton Town extend Sunderland keeper's loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21964851 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref> During this spell, Pickford kept five [[clean sheets]] in twelve matches.<ref name="burtonloan">{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Burton agree deal Sunderland keeper |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23540671 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 August 2013}}</ref>
====Loans to Burton Albion and Carlisle United==== On 2 August 2013, Pickford signed another loan deal, this time with [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club Burton Albion,<ref name="burtonloan"/> and made his debut the next day against [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]].<ref name="soccerbase">{{soccerbase|id=63860|name=Jordan Pickford}}</ref> However, his loan ended on 17 August, after Sunderland recalled him with Pickford featuring just three times for Burton.<ref name="burtontermination">{{cite news |title=Derby County keeper joins Burton Albion on loan |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-keeper-joins-Burton-Albion-loan/story-19673066-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |accessdate=17 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820084821/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-keeper-joins-Burton-Albion-loan/story-19673066-detail/story.html |archivedate=20 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Lyness steps up as Pickford recalled |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/lyness-steps-pickford-recalled/story-19677394-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=19 August 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017192659/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/lyness-steps-pickford-recalled/story-19677394-detail/story.html |archivedate=17 October 2016}}</ref> On 13 September, Pickford re-joined Burton on loan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/pickfordreturn-1049311.aspx |title=Pickford back at the Pirelli |publisher=Burton Albion F.C. |date=13 September 2013 |accessdate=7 December 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305074939/http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/pickfordreturn-1049311.aspx |archivedate=5 March 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> His handful of first-team appearances at Burton Albion led to an extension of his loan spell for another month.<ref>{{cite news |title=Burton Albion extend loan of Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton-albion-extend-loan-sunderland-goalkeeper/story-19939108-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=16 October 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019093740/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Burton-Albion-extend-loan-Sunderland-goalkeeper/story-19939108-detail/story.html |archivedate=19 October 2013}}</ref> After making 12 appearances across his two loan spells, Pickford was recalled by his parent club once again.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/20131122-pickford-1190533.aspx |title=Pickford Recalled |publisher=Burton Albion F.C. |date=22 November 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017192406/http://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/article/20131122-pickford-1190533.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He subsequently spent 11 matches as an unused substitute on the bench as a cover for [[Vito Mannone]] between 23 November 2013 and 18 January 2014.<ref name=auto>{{cite news |title=Sunderland goalkeeper facing lengthy spell on the sidelines as operation looks likely |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/10890580.Sunderland_goalkeeper_facing_lengthy_spell_on_the_sidelines_as_operation_looks_likely/ |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=20 November 2013 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
Although it was rumoured that he could return on loan to Burton for the third time,<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford not set for third Burton Albion loan |url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/pickford-set-burton-loan/story-20493573-detail/story.html |newspaper=Derby Telegraph |date=24 January 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Pickford joined League One club [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] on a one-month loan on 8 February 2014.<ref>{{cite web |title=Loan: Keeper joins Cumbrians |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloan7feb14-1345128.aspx |publisher=Carlisle United F.C. |date=8 February 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304052314/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloan7feb14-1345128.aspx |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> He made his debut that same day in a 2–1 loss away to [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25994422 |title=Carlisle United 1–2 Gillingham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 February 2014 |accessdate=13 June 2018}}</ref> His form and handful of first-team appearances led the club to keep him on loan for the rest of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloanextends10march14-1409746.aspx |title=Loan: Keeper sticks with United |publisher=Carlisle United F.C. |date=14 March 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017194959/http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/pickfordloanextends10march14-1409746.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref> After extending his loan at the club, Pickford went on to make 18 appearances for Carlisle.<ref name=sb1314/>
At the end of the 2013–14 season, Pickford signed a four-year contract with Sunderland, keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sunderland tie youngster to long-term deal |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/11248898.Sunderland_tie_youngster_to_long_term_deal |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=1 June 2014 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Bradford City==== On 21 July 2014, Pickford joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club Bradford City on a season-long loan for the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite web |title=Pickford on the move |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2014/july/pickford-on-the-move |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |accessdate=21 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140721121410/http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2014/july/pickford-on-the-move |archivedate=21 July 2014}}</ref> He made his debut on 9 August in a 3–2 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] at [[Valley Parade]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28646631 |title=Bradford City 3–2 Coventry City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> and kept his first clean sheet in the following match, a 0–0 draw away to [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28716713 |title=Walsall 0–0 Bradford City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Pickford then received his first ever red card after he was sent off in the 11th minute of a 2–1 loss to [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on 10 January 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Bradford City 1–2 Rochdale |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30663535 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> He served a one-match suspension which his club did not appeal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-decide-against-pickford-appeal-2197948.aspx |title=City decide against Pickford appeal |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=12 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017202706/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-decide-against-pickford-appeal-2197948.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
On 7 February, he was once again expelled from play as he was sent off in the last minute of a 2–2 away draw against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Port Vale 2–2 Bradford City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31070834 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 February 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> After being given a two-match ban, the club successfully appealed and had it revoked.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-set-for-two-match-ban-2254726.aspx |title=Pickford set for two-match ban |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=7 February 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150313123205/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-set-for-two-match-ban-2254726.aspx |archivedate=13 March 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-win-pickford-appeal-2257188.aspx |title=City win Pickford appeal |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=9 January 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161017203251/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/city-win-pickford-appeal-2257188.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2016 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
Pickford established himself as a first-choice goalkeeper for most of the season until he was recalled by his parent club on 9 March 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-returns-to-sunderland-2323603.aspx |title=Pickford returns to Sunderland |publisher=Bradford City A.F.C. |date=9 March 2015 |accessdate=17 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150322175418/http://www.bradfordcityfc.co.uk/news/article/pickford-returns-to-sunderland-2323603.aspx |archivedate=22 March 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
====Loan to Preston North End==== On 31 July 2015, Pickford joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on a season-long loan for the [[2015–16 Preston North End F.C. season|2015–16 season]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Pickford Joins Preston |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2015/july/pickford-joins-preston |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |date=31 July 2015}}</ref> He kept a clean sheet on his debut in a 0–0 draw against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] at [[Deepdale]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Aloia |first=Andrew |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750467 |title=Preston North End 0–0 Middlesbrough |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
Further clean sheets in a 1–0 win against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in his second league appearance and a 0–0 draw with [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 18 August made it three clean sheets from his first three league appearances for the club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33831740 |title=MK Dons 0–1 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33857728 |title=Rotherham United 0–0 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2015 |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> On 25 August, Pickford kept another clean sheet as Preston defeated [[Premier League]] team [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] 1–0 in the [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33969908 |title=Preston 1–0 Watford |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=29 October 2017}}</ref> On 7 November, he recorded a 6th consecutive clean sheet in a 0–0 draw against QPR, equalling the club record.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/sam-allardyce-keeping-close-eye-on-preston-s-on-loan-sunderland-keeper-jordan-pickford-1-7553951 |title=Sam Allardyce keeping close eye on Preston's on-loan Sunderland keeper Jordan Pickford |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34685931 |title=Queens Park Rangers 0–0 Preston North End |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> During his stint at Preston, Pickford impressed his veteran goalkeeping teammate [[Chris Kirkland]], who said "Jordan comes out to take crosses and has an authority for someone still very young... As for his kicking, that is brilliant! I have never seen anyone kick a ball like he does."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/going-to-the-top-pickford-could-keep-sunderland-up-says-chris-kirkland-1-7634077 |title='Going to the top' Pickford could keep Sunderland up, says Chris Kirkland |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> On 20 December 2015, Pickford was controversially sent off in a 1–0 defeat against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]]: he rushed out of his box to challenge striker [[Chris Wood (footballer, born 1991)|Chris Wood]], and was judged to have handled the ball.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/national-football/pne-set-to-appeal-pickford-dismissal-1-7635514 |title=PNE set to appeal Pickford dismissal |newspaper=Lancashire Evening Post |location=Preston |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Preston successfully appealed the decision, using replay footage that showed the ball hitting his chest.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/national-football/pne-keeper-pickford-wins-red-card-appeal-1-7638855 |title=PNE keeper Pickford wins red card appeal |newspaper=Lancashire Evening Post |location=Preston |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
====Return to Sunderland==== On 1 January 2016, Pickford was recalled by Sunderland, with the side struggling in 19th place in the [[2015–16 Premier League|Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Man Utd's Sam Johnstone off on loan to Preston North End |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11697/10115470/man-utds-sam-johnstone-off-on-loan-to-preston-north-end |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=31 December 2015}}</ref> He made his first-team debut on 9 January 2016, in a 3–1 [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup]] loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal 3 Sunderland 1: Gunners fight back to knock Cats out of FA Cup |url=http://www.shieldsgazette.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/arsenal-3-sunderland-1-gunners-fight-back-to-knock-cats-out-of-fa-cup-1-7665597 |newspaper=Shields Gazette |accessdate=9 January 2016}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]] on 16 January 2016 losing 4–1, meaning he had played in the top five leagues of English football by the age of 21.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/60834 |title=Pickford promise fulfilled for club and country |publisher=Premier League |date=16 July 2016 |accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref> On 26 January, Pickford signed a new contract committing his future to Sunderland until 2020.<ref name="skysports.com"/>
Pickford began the [[2016–17 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2016–17]] season as understudy to Vito Mannone. However, after Mannone suffered a serious arm injury in training, Pickford started Sunderland's third league match of the season, away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. He produced several saves during the match, but in the 85th minute he made an error which allowed [[Jay Rodriguez]] to equalise for the hosts in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3761414/Southampton-1-1-Sunderland-Super-sub-Jay-Rodriguez-strikes-level-Jermain-Defore-penalty-Saints-grandstand-finish-t-force-victory.html |title=Southampton 1–1 Sunderland: David Moyes refuses to deny interest in Joe Hart after Jordan Pickford error costs Black Cats first win in August since 2010 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=11 October 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=October 2017}}</ref><ref name="Echo_October2016"/> On 13 April 2017, Pickford was named as one of six players shortlisted for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/4/13/pfa-mens-young-player-of-the-year |title=Men's PFA Young Player of the Year 2017 |date=13 April 2017 |publisher=Professional Footballers' Association}}</ref>
===Everton=== ====2017–18 season==== On 15 June 2017, Pickford signed for Premier League club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on a five-year contract. The initial fee of £25 million, with the possibility of rising to £30 million in add-ons, made him [[Goalkeeper (association football)#Highest fees|the third most expensive goalkeeper in history]], the most expensive British goalkeeper of all time and will make him Everton's second most expensive signing, pending add-on payments,<ref>{{cite news |title=Jordan Pickford: Everton confirm £25m, rising to £30m, deal with Sunderland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40258852 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}}</ref> as [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] is currently the club's most expensive signing with £40 million plus add-on payments.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40848343 |title=Gylfi Sigurdsson: Everton sign £45m deal for Swansea midfielder |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2017 |accessdate=9 September 2017}}</ref> Pickford made his league debut for Everton on 12 August 2017, when his club beat [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] 1–0 at Goodison Park.<ref name=sb1718/> At the conclusion of his first season, he was named Everton's Player of the Season, along with numerous other club accolades.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11671/11355385/jordan-pickford-honoured-after-dominating-everton-awards-night |title=Jordan Pickford 'honoured' after dominating Everton awards night |publisher=Sky Sports |date=1 May 2017 |accessdate=4 July 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 2 December 2018, against [[Merseyside derby|local rivals]] [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Pickford made a last-minute mistake after he mishandled a volley from [[Virgil van Dijk]], allowing [[Divock Origi]] to score the winning goal for Liverpool from a close-range header in the 96th minute.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46333097 |title=Liverpool 1–0 Everton: Jordan Pickford error gifts Divock Origi late winner |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-everton-jordan-pickford-mistake-goal-error-divock-origi-a8664181.html |title= Liverpool vs Everton: Jordan Pickford explains what he was trying to do in 'freak' mistake |publisher=The Independent |date=2 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018}}</ref>
On 10 March 2019, against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], Pickford misjudged a cross from [[Matt Ritchie]] and then [[Tackle (football move)#Rugby union|rugby tackle]]d [[Salomón Rondón]], conceding a penalty. He quickly redeemed himself by saving Ritchie's penalty with his legs, and Everton doubled their lead a minute later.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/03/09/villain-hero-scapegoat-jordan-pickford-spotlight-newcastle/ |title=From villain, to hero, to scapegoat - Jordan Pickford in the spotlight as Newcastle fight back to stun Everton|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]] |date=9 March 2019 |accessdate=21 March 2019}}</ref> In the second half, when an effort by Rondón went wide of the post, Pickford was seen smiling at the Newcastle fans in the Gallowgate end. However, he conceded three times after that, including parrying a shot by [[Miguel Almirón]] into the path of [[Ayoze Pérez]]. On ''[[Match of the Day]]'', [[Ian Wright]] suggested that Pickford should have focused on his game more, and given he was a former Sunderland player, not let his emotions affect him.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47424848|title=Newcastle United 3–2 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 March 2019|accessdate=22 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== [[File:2017083200955 2017-03-24 Fussball U21 Deutschland vs England - Sven - 1D X - 0153 - DV3P6479 - Jordan Pickford.jpg|thumb|upright|Pickford playing for [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] in 2017]]
Pickford has represented the England international team at every level from under-16s to under-21s.<ref name="Echo_October2016">{{cite news |title=10 things you may not know about England new boy Jordan Pickford |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/football/sunderland-afc/10-things-you-may-not-know-about-england-new-boy-jordan-pickford-1-8173261 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=13 June 2017 |language=en}}</ref> In October 2009, he made his [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] debut against [[Wales national under-16 football team|Wales U16]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bruce chasing Zenden |url=http://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/sport/4686565.Bruce_chasing_Zenden |newspaper=The Northern Echo |location=Darlington |date=16 October 2009 |accessdate=17 October 2016}}</ref> In 2011, Pickford represented England at the [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup]]. In a game versus Canada, Pickford allowed an 86th-minute goal, from a downfield kick by Canadian goalkeeper [[Quillan Roberts]] which tied the game in a 2–2 draw,<ref>{{Cite news |title=Canadian goalkeeper makes history with goal at u17 World Cup |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/sports/soccer/canadian-goalkeeper-makes-history-with-goal-at-u-17-world-cup/article584267/ |publisher=The Globe and Mail |accessdate=5 April 2014}}</ref> which remains as the only goal scored by a goalkeeper in a FIFA finals to date from open play.<ref>{{cite web |title=Uruguay advance as records fell |url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/news/newsid=1458456/index.html |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=14 July 2018}}</ref>
On 25 August 2015, he was called up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] squad for the first time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/sunderland-s-duncan-watmore-and-jordan-pickford-selected-for-england-u21s-1-7427777 |title=Sunderland's Duncan Watmore and Jordan Pickford selected for England U21s |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> Pickford made his debut for the under-21s in a [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] against the [[United States men's national under-23 soccer team|United States under-23s]] at Deepdale on 3 September 2015.<ref name="Echo_October2016"/>
On 14 October, Pickford assisted [[Nathan Redmond]]'s goal in the England U21s' 3–0 victory over [[Kazakhstan national under-21 football team|Kazakhstan]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]] with a long range pass from his own penalty area.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/sunderland-afc/latest-safc-news/safc-match-analysis/watch-sunderland-s-ace-goalkeeper-jordan-pickford-hailed-after-england-assist-1-7513763 |title=Watch: Sunderland's ace goalkeeper Jordan Pickford hailed after England assist |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref> His team won the [[2016 Toulon Tournament]], their first in 22 years.<ref name=toulon>{{cite news |title=England Under-21s win Toulon Tournament for first time in 22 years |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36410296 |accessdate=11 October 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2016}}</ref>
On 9 October 2016, Pickford received his first call-up to the [[England national football team|senior squad]], replacing an injured [[Tom Heaton]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifier]] against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2016/october/pickford-gets-england-call |title=Pickford for England |publisher=Sunderland A.F.C. |accessdate=11 October 2016}}</ref>
Pickford led the England under-21 to the semi-final of the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in June 2017 with a string of strong performances.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2017/06/30/36749952/saul-pickford-star-in-euro-under-21-team-of-the-tournament |title=Saul & Pickford star in Euro Under-21 Team of the Tournament |publisher=Goal.com |date=30 June 2017}}</ref>
===Senior team=== [[File:Jordan Pickford 2018-07-03 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Pickford playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
On 24 August 2017, Pickford was called up to the England squad by manager [[Gareth Southgate]] for two 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against [[Malta national football team|Malta]] and [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/24/england-squad-maguire-chalobah-slovakia-malta |title=Harry Maguire and Nathaniel Chalobah called up to England squad for first time |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=24 August 2017 |accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref> However, he later withdrew from the squad due to injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/29/jordan-pickford-out-england-squad-world-cup-qualifiers |title=Jordan Pickford ruled out of England's squad for World Cup qualifiers |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=29 August 2017 |accessdate=5 September 2017}}</ref> Pickford made his debut in a friendly on 10 November 2017, starting as England drew 0–0 with [[Germany national football team|Germany]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=England 0–0 Germany |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41854505 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2017 |accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref>
Pickford was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> He started the opening match against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]], which England won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44434276 |title=Tunisia 1–2 England |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 June 2018 |accessdate=19 June 2018}}</ref> In their round of 16 match on 3 July, Pickford helped England beat [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] 4–3 on [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]] after a 1–1 draw, saving from [[Carlos Bacca]], to claim his nation's first World Cup penalty shoot-out victory and a place in the quarter-final.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44610244 |title=Colombia 1–1 England |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 July 2018 |accessdate=3 July 2018}}</ref>
On 7 July 2018, Pickford kept his first clean sheet of the World Cup and was named man of the match, as England knocked out [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] with a 2–0 win in the quarter-finals. The result earned England a place in the semi-finals of the World Cup for the first time since [[1990 FIFA World Cup|1990]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44665445 |title=World Cup 2018: England beat Sweden 2–0 to reach semi-finals |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 July 2018 |accessdate=7 July 2018}}</ref>

nationalteam-update = 22:55, 5 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Leighton John Baines''' (born 11 December 1984) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], where he is also vice-captain, and the [[England national football team|England national team]].
Baines started his career with [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], and was part of the team that won the [[Football League Second Division|Second Division]] in the [[2002–03 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2002–03 season]] and was a runner-up in the [[2004–05 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2004–05]] [[EFL Championship|Championship]] and the [[2006 Football League Cup Final|2006 League Cup Final]]. He joined Everton in 2007, helping them reach the [[2009 FA Cup Final]]. He has played for England at [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] and senior levels. Baines was included in the England squads at [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Wigan Athletic=== Baines made his debut for [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] in 2002, and was a member of the team that won the [[Football League Second Division|Second Division]] in the [[2002–03 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2002–03 season]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was a regular in the first team when Wigan earned promotion to the [[Premier League]] in [[2004–05 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2004–05]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} That season saw Baines score his first goal for the club, a long-range shot against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
When he secured promotion with Wigan, he doubted he was good enough to play in the Premier League: "We won promotion to the Premier League and, straight away, I was thinking, 'Where am I going to go now?' I should have been celebrating but I spent a large part of that summer worrying about what it would be like spending the next year on the bench and in the reserves."<ref>{{cite news|last=Taylor|first=Daniel|title=Baines thriving after test of his fragile nerve|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2007/sep/29/newsstory.everton|newspaper=The Guardian|date=29 September 2007|location=London}}</ref>
Baines signed a new contract with Wigan in February 2005 despite being linked to a number of Premier League clubs, including [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Everton F.C.|Everton]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Baines commits to Latics |url=http://home.skysports.com/list.asp?hlid=254724&plid=12745&clid=111&cpid=10 |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=23 September 2006 }}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> and extended his contract again after impressive displays in his first season in the Premier League.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Whilst at Wigan he started in the [[2006 Football League Cup Final|2006 League Cup Final]] defeat to Manchester United.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/league_cup/4727118.stm|title=Man Utd ease to Carling Cup glory|publisher=[[BBC|British Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=26 February 2006}}</ref>
===Everton=== [[File:Leighton Baines throw-in.jpg|thumb|upright|Baines playing for [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2009]]
In July 2007, Baines rejected a move to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], after their bid of a reported £6 million was accepted by Wigan.<ref>{{cite news |title=Baines rejects Sunderland switch |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sunderland/6288856.stm |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 July 2007 | date=25 July 2007}}</ref> In the following month he signed for Everton for an initial fee of £5 million, with another £1 million in add-ons, dependent on Baines's appearances for Everton.<ref>{{cite news |title=Baines joins Everton |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_2643417,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports | accessdate=6 August 2007 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/6934188.stm |title=Everton capture Baines from Wigan |date=7 August 2007 |accessdate=7 August 2007 |publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref>
Baines did not play regularly in his first season, making just 29 appearances in all competitions, due to an injury and the good form of [[Phil Jagielka]] and [[Joseph Yobo]] at centre back which kept [[Joleon Lescott]] at left back.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} His second season at Everton saw an increase in Baines's playing time.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Due to an injury to Yobo, Lescott moved to the centre of defence and Baines played at left back.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was voted Player of the Month at Everton two months in a row in the 2008–09 season.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} Baines scored his first ever Everton goal against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on 21 March, at [[Fratton Park]], after 57 matches (in all competitions) without scoring.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} On 30 August 2009, he scored a last minute [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] in a 2–1 win over his former team Wigan.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} A month later, he [[captain (association football)|captained]] Everton for the first time in a [[UEFA Europa League]] match against [[AEK Athens F.C.|AEK Athens]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000037/match=2000779/index.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221032540/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season%3D2010/round%3D2000037/match%3D2000779/index.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=21 February 2010 |title=Everton revived on Europa League stage |publisher=UEFA |date=17 September 2009}}</ref>
In the [[2010–11 Everton F.C. season|2010–11 season]], Baines played every minute of Everton's Premier League matches,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2011/may/26/premier-league-opta-statistics|title=Number-crunching makes grim reading for Arsenal's defence|first=Paul|last=Doyle|newspaper=The Guardian|date=26 May 2011|accessdate=26 May 2011|location=London}}</ref> as well as scoring seven goals in all competitions. His contribution was rewarded with the club's Player of the Season, Players' Player of the Season, and Goal of the Season awards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/history/player-of-season|title=Baines' Glorious Treble|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=20 May 2011|accessdate=20 May 2011}}</ref> His goal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], scored from direct free kick, was voted Everton Goal of the Season.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He also contributed 11 assists throughout the season, 5th overall in the league, and was the league's highest assisting defender.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}}
[[File:Leighton Baines 2011.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Baines playing for Everton in 2011]]
Baines scored five times during [[2011–12 Everton F.C. season|2011–12]], four of which were penalties.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He reached 99 consecutive league matches before ending his season early due to injury.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/19/everton-leighton-baines-euro-2012 | title=Everton's Leighton Baines hamstrung but should be fit for Euro 2012 |newspaper=The Guardian | date=19 April 2012 | accessdate=23 April 2012 | author=Hunter, Andy | location=London}}</ref> His performance at left back was deemed impressive enough to be named in the [[Professional Footballers' Association|PFA]]'s Premier League Team of the Year in 2012, the first Everton player to do so for 22 years since [[Neville Southall]] in 1989–90.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/apr/22/robin-van-persie-pfa-player-of-year | title=Arsenal's Robin van Persie is honoured to win PFA player of year award |newspaper=The Guardian | date=23 April 2012 | accessdate=23 April 2012 | location=London}}</ref>
During the [[2012–13 Everton F.C. season|2012–13 season]], Baines created 116 chances for his teammates,<ref name=ESPN>{{cite web | url=http://espnfc.com/blog/_/name/everton/id/925?&cc=5739 | title=Chelsea defeat epitomises the season for Everton | publisher=ESPN FC | accessdate=19 May 2013}}</ref> more than any other player in Europe's top five leagues.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2305726/Leighton-Baines-David-Silva-Luis-Suarez-create-chances-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Lionel-Messi.html | title=Forget Messi and Ronaldo, it's Premier League defender Baines who creates more chances than anyone in Europe | newspaper=Daily Mail | accessdate=19 May 2013 | location=London | first=Simon | last=Cass | date=8 April 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> When 2013's PFA Premier League Team of the Year was announced, Baines was again included,<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/28/tottenham-gareth-bale-pfa-player-of-year | title=Tottenham's Gareth Bale wins PFA player of year award for second time | newspaper=The Guardian | date=29 April 2013 | accessdate=30 April 2013 | author=Riach, James | location=London}}</ref> and he also won Everton's [[List of Everton F.C. records and statistics#Evertonfc.com player awards|Player of the Season]] and Players' Player of the Season awards.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.evertonfc.com/history/baines-named-player-of-the-season | title=Baines Named Player of the Season | publisher=Everton F.C. | accessdate=19 May 2013}}</ref> Baines was the only outfield player to have played in every minute of every Premier League match during the season.<ref name=ESPN/> He was the subject of multiple bids during the 2013 summer transfer window from Manchester United but all were rejected by Everton.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton/10286980/Everton-keen-to-reward-Leighton-Baines-with-new-deal.html | title=Everton keen to reward Leighton Baines with new deal | newspaper=The Daily Telegraph | accessdate=5 September 2013 | location=London | first=Chris | last=Bascombe | date=4 September 2013}}</ref>
Baines scored two free-kicks either side of goalkeeper [[Jussi Jääskeläinen]] from the same position as Everton beat [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] 3–2 in September.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2426891/West-Ham-2-Everton-3--match-report-Leighton-Baines-scores-free-kicks.html | title=West Ham 2 Everton 3: Lukaku on debut and two stunners from Baines see off Hammers in thriller | newspaper=Daily Mail | accessdate=21 September 2013 | location=London | first=Mark | last=Ryan | date=21 September 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> He was only the fifth player since 2006–07 to score two direct free-kicks in one Premier League match (after Rooney, Ronaldo, Drogba and Larsson).<ref>{{cite news |title=The FourFourTwo Preview: Everton vs Newcastle|magazine=FourFourTwo |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/fourfourtwo-preview-everton-vs-newcastle|accessdate=14 November 2013|date=26 September 2014}}</ref> Baines suffered a toe injury in November which saw him miss a top flight fixture for the first time in 52 matches.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gerard-deulofeu-needs-keep-playing-6362420 | title=Deulofeu needs to keep playing with a smile – Martinez | newspaper=Liverpool Echo | accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> On 27 January 2014, Baines signed a four-year deal to extend his contract at Everton.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25910996 |title = Leighton Baines: Everton defender signs new deal with club| publisher = BBC Sport | accessdate = 27 January 2014 | date = 27 January 2014}}</ref> He scored three penalties during the season to take his career tally to 13, becoming the first player in Premier League history to have taken more than 10 and never missed one.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2014/01/02/leighton-baines-penalties-record_n_4531248.html | title=Everton's Leighton Baines Scores Record 11th Premier League Penalty |newspaper=HuffPost |location=New York | accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref> The 13th came on his 300th appearance in the competition in a 2–0 win over Manchester United.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.skysports.com/opinion/story/0,25212,12038_9277213,00.html | title=Champs minus blanks | publisher=Sky Sports | accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref> Baines scored five goals and assisted four others during [[2013–14 Everton F.C. season|2013–14]], the most of any defender in the league.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/may/matchweek-37-post-match-stats.html | title=MW37 stats: Liverpool set away goals mark | publisher=Premier League | accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref>
He scored his first ever goal in European football for Everton on 18 September 2014, netting from the penalty spot in a 4–1 win over [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] in the first match of their UEFA Europa League campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29240782 |title=Everton marked their Europa League return with a dominant victory over Germans Wolfsburg at Goodison Park. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2014 |accessdate=18 September 2014 }}</ref> On 5 October 2014, his penalty against Manchester United was saved by [[David de Gea]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} This was the first time he did not score from a penalty in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-united-vs-everton-leighton-baines-misses-first-penalty-of-his-premier-league-career-9775336.html |title=Leighton Baines misses first penalty of his Premier League career. |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=5 October 2014 |accessdate=5 October 2014 }}</ref> In January 2015, Baines made his 45th assist in the Premier League to overtake [[Graeme Le Saux]] as the defender with the most in the division's history.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/article-2906579/Leighton-Baines-defender-assists-Premier-League-history.html | title=Leighton Baines is the defender with most assists in Premier League history – who joins the Everton star? | newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London | accessdate=14 January 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Baines missed the beginning of [[2015–16 Everton F.C. season|2015–16]] after injuring his ankle in training just before the Premier League started.<ref>{{cite web|title=Everton's Leighton Baines has ankle surgery, out 12 to 14 weeks|url=http://www.espnfc.com/everton/story/2562296/everton-leighton-baines-has-ankle-surgery-out-12-14-weeks|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=14 August 2015|date=14 August 2015}}</ref> Baines became the third defender to score 30 Premier League goals after [[John Terry]] (40) and [[David Unsworth]] (38) when he scored for Everton in a 3–0 win against Southampton on 2 January 2017.<ref>{{cite web|title=Everton 3–0 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38433524 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 January 2017 |accessdate=2 January 2017}}</ref> Baines became the first defender to reach 50 Premier League assists on 15 April 2017.<ref name=Burnley>{{cite news |title=Everton 3–1 Burnley |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39536681 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 April 2017 |accessdate=16 April 2017}}</ref> Everton manager Ronald Koeman had reiterated Baines is Everton's first-choice penalty taker after he equalled the club's spot-kick record.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/koeman-confirms-baines-once-again-12395881| newspaper=Liverpool Echo |location=Liverpool | title=Koeman confirms that Baines is once again Everton's first-choice penalty taker|first=Greg|last=O'Keeffe| date=1 July 2017}}</ref>
Baines scored the winner for Everton in the UEFA Europa League third qualifying round first leg against Slovakian side [[MFK Ružomberok|Ružomberok]] on 27 July 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40724022| publisher=BBC |location=UK | title=Everton 1 – 0 Ruzomberok|first=Tom|last=Rostance| date=27 July 2017}}</ref> By scoring a penalty in a 3–2 home win over Watford on 5 November 2017, Baines became Everton's leading Premier League penalty scorer.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41792811| publisher=BBC |location=UK | title=Everton 3–2 Watford|first=Caroline |last=Chapman| date=5 November 2017}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Mohammed Abdellaoue defended by Leigton Baines Norway-England (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Baines ''(left, in navy blue)'' playing for [[England national football team|England]] in 2012]]
Baines made his debut for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21s]] in a [[2006 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification]] away to [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria]] in September 2004 under [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]].<ref>{{cite journal|title=The boy's a bit special|journal=FourFourTwo|date=December 2004}}</ref><ref name=UEFA/>
In the following campaign Baines scored a vital goal for the England under-21 team against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] on 6 October 2006, securing a 1–0 win in the first leg of a UEFA European U21 Championship play-off.<ref>{{cite news|title=Baines stunner boosts England|date=6 October 2006|first=Kevin|last=Ashby |publisher=UEFA |url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=464439.html|accessdate=1 January 2017}}</ref> He played all four of England's matches in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] finals.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} In total he played 16 times for the under-21 team and scored one goal.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
With [[Wayne Bridge]] retiring from international duties, Baines was called up to the senior [[England national football team|England]] squad for the first time in March 2009,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1254605/Everton-star-Leighton-Baines-eager-make-Wayne-Bridges-England-snub.html |title=Everton star Leighton Baines eager to make the most of Wayne Bridge's England snub | location=London |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=2 March 2010}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> and made his full international debut in a [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] against [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] on 3 March 2010, playing the full 90 minutes of a 3–1 win for England.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8545630.stm|title=England 3–1 Egypt|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 March 2010|accessdate=4 March 2010|first=Phil |last=McNulty }}</ref> He was selected in a provisional squad of 30 players for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]],<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8673706.stm |publisher=BBC Sport | title=Capello names surprise Cup squad | date=11 May 2010}}</ref> but did not make the final squad of 23 players to be taken to South Africa,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8713742.stm|title=World Cup 2010: Walcott left out of England squad |publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 June 2010|accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref> with [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] left back [[Stephen Warnock]], who had not played in the warm-up matches, taken in his place.<ref>{{cite news |title=It's not for kids! Leighton Baines axed from World Cup squad by Fabio Capello outside toy shop |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1347576/Its-kids-Leighton-Baines-axed-World-Cup-squad-Fabio-Capello-outside-toy-shop.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=16 January 2011 |location=London |first=Joe |last=Bernstein}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Baines made his competitive international debut on 4 June 2011, replacing the injured [[Ashley Cole]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifier]] against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]],<ref name=UEFA/> assisting [[Ashley Young]] for England's equalising goal.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
Baines was named in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]] in May,<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18081125 | title=England Euro 2012 squad: Ruddy, Carroll & Defoe in, Ferdinand out |publisher=BBC Sport | date=16 May 2012 | accessdate=19 May 2012}}</ref> but did not feature in the tournament with Hodgson using Ashley Cole for all four of England's matches.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/teams/team=39/index.html | title=England Squad | publisher=UEFA | accessdate=16 August 2012}}</ref>
In September 2012, he scored his first international goal against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match, a deflected free kick which was the last of England's goals in a 5–0 win.<ref name=Moldova>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Moldova 0–5 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19460608 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 September 2012 |accessdate=20 April 2016}}</ref>
On 30 May 2014, Baines' corners in a Wembley friendly against [[Peru national football team|Peru]] led to two of England's goals in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=England 3–0 Peru|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383301|accessdate=30 May 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 May 2014}}</ref>
He played full in England's first two matches in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] (against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] and [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]),<ref>{{cite web |url=https://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/02/37/18/57/eng_08_0614_eng-ita_fulltime.pdf |title=Match report – Group D – England v Italy |website=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |format=PDF |date=14 June 2014 |access-date=24 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://resources.fifa.com/mm/document/tournament/competition/02/37/78/35/eng_23_0619_uru-eng_fulltime.pdf |title=Match report – Group D – Uruguay v England |website=FIFA.com |publisher=Fédération Internationale de Football Association |format=PDF |date=19 June 2014 |access-date=24 September 2018}}</ref> both ended in 1–2 defeats as the team [[2014 FIFA World Cup Group D|was eliminated]] in the first round of the World Cup for the first time since [[1958 FIFA World Cup|1958]].<ref>{{cite web|title=World Cup 2014: England knocked out of World Cup |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27935803|accessdate=24 September 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 June 2014}}</ref>
==Style of play== Baines is described in his UEFA.com profile as a "dependable left back" who is "best known for his [[Direct free kick|set-piece]] expertise and penalties".<ref name=UEFA>{{cite web |title=Leighton Baines |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325052321/http://www.uefa.com/teamsandplayers/players/player%3D95588/profile/index.html |archivedate=25 March 2015 |date=30 October 2014 |publisher=UEFA |url=http://www.uefa.com/teamsandplayers/players/player=95588/profile/index.html |deadurl=yes}}<!-- written as deadlink, profile as of January 2017 features just stats and no prose; would return a "not in citation given" situation --></ref> But in his early years, Baines played in midfield and attack; it was only when he started at Wigan that he began to play in the left back position.<ref>{{cite news|first=Dominic|last=King|title=Leighton Baines: I'm not afraid of anyone, but I had to run from Liam Gallagher|date=30 April 2011|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1381996/Leighton-Baines-Im-afraid-I-run-Liam-Gallagher.html|newspaper=Daily Mail}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> [[Roberto Martínez]] had planned to redeploy Baines as a midfielder, in a similar change to [[Philipp Lahm]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Baines has stated that he would be "excited to give it a go".<ref>{{cite news|first=Chris|last=Bascombe|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton/10805357/Leighton-Baines-Why-I-stayed-at-Everton-but-feel-gutted-for-David-Moyes-after-Manchester-United-sack.html|title=Leighton Baines: Why I stayed at Everton but feel 'gutted' for David Moyes after Manchester United sack|date=2 May 2014}}</ref>
Baines is the current record holder of the most assists as a defender in the Premier League.<ref name=Burnley/>
==Personal life== Baines was born and raised in [[Kirkby]], Merseyside<ref>{{cite web|last1=Nicoli|first1=Luke|title=Leighton Baines: Talentspotter|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/leighton-baines-talentspotter|website=FourFourTwo|accessdate=16 June 2017|date=1 November 2004}}</ref> and was educated at St Joseph The Worker Catholic Primary School<ref>{{cite web|url=http://community.evertonfc.com/news/baines-goes-back-to-school/|title=Baines Goes Back to School|publisher=Everton in the Community|accessdate=22 August 2014}}</ref> and All Saints' RC High School in Kirkby.{{citation needed|date=January 2014}} He began playing football at a local Liverpool primary school but, age 10, had trouble playing for a Sunday League team because he was shy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-420045/The-fear-failure-driving-Baines-on.html|title=The Fear of Failure That Is Driving Baines On|last=Lawton|first=Matt|date=2 December 2006|newspaper=Daily Mail|accessdate=3 March 2010 | location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> He has three children with his wife, Rachel.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/mar/03/england-egypt-live|title=England v Egypt – as it happened|last=Lutz|first=Tom|date=3 March 2010|newspaper=The Guardian|accessdate=3 March 2010 | location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-420045/The-fear-failure-driving-Baines-on.html/|title=The fear of failure that is driving Baines on|last=Lawton|first=Matt|newspaper=Daily Mail|accessdate=2 January 2013|location=London|date=2 December 2006}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Baines is a close friend of musician [[Miles Kane]],<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/how-we-met-leighton-baines--miles-kane-8483819.html | location=London | newspaper=The Independent | first=Adam | last=Jacques | title=How We Met: Leighton Baines & Miles Kane | date=10 February 2013}}</ref> and is himself a keen guitarist.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2260147/Leighton-Baines-talks-guitar-music-Miles-Kane-Arctic-Monkeys.html | location=London | newspaper=Daily Mail | title=You might think all footballers listen to R&B... but some of us like decent music, says Everton star Baines | first=James | last=Andrew | date=10 January 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref>

'''Michael Keane''' or '''Mike Keane''' may refer to:
* [[Michael Keane (footballer, born 1982)]], former Irish footballer who played for St Patrick's Athletic * [[Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993)]], English footballer who plays for Everton * [[Michael Keane (economist)]] (born 1961), Plus Alliance Professor at UNSW Business School and King's College London * Michael Keane, a [[List of Grand Theft Auto IV characters#Michael Keane|video game character in ''Grand Theft Auto IV'']] * Michael Keane, per historical anecdote, a blind Irish harp player at [[Fort Oswego#Michael Keane|Fort Oswego]]
== See also == * [[Mike Keane]] (born 1967), retired Canadian ice hockey player * [[Michael Keen (disambiguation)]]
