The match ended 1–0 and Walcott's goal became the fastest goal of the Premier League that season.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22320618|title=QPR 0–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|last=Bevan|first=Chris}} Walcott scored another goal in a 4–1 victory over Wigan Athletic which resulted in Wigan's relegation.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22430454|title=Arsenal 4–1 Wigan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 May 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|last=McKenna|first=Chris}} Walcott finished the season with 14 goals and 12 assists from 32 Premier League matches and scoring 21 times with 16 assists in all competitions to be Arsenal's top scorer. ====2013–14 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott - FA Cup parade.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott celebrating with teammates and fans at a parade after winning the [[2013–14 FA Cup]]]] Walcott started the [[2013–14 Arsenal F.C. season|2013–14 campaign]] in good form, registering assists against [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|Champions League play-off round]] as well as against Fulham and Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23691545 |title=Fenerbahce 0–3 Arsenal |first=Mike |last=Henson |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23744679 |title=Fulham 1–3 Arsenal |first=Owen |last=Phillips |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/23831033 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Tottenham |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} and scoring against [[Olympique de Marseille]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group F|Champions League group stage]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24044269 |title=Marseille 1–2 Arsenal |first=Alistair |last=Magowan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} He suffered an abdominal injury in late September that required surgery,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24224434 |title=Theo Walcott: Arsenal winger to miss World Cup qualifiers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} and was out of action for two months, returning against his former club Southampton in late November.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24968973 |title=Arsenal 2–0 Southampton |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 November 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} He appeared as a substitute in Arsenal's next four fixtures, assisting goals against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] and Everton, and started his first match since returning from injury,{{cite web |url=http://www.thearsenalhistory.com/stat/aftlu.htm |title=Arsenal first team line-ups |first=Andy |last=Kelly |website=The Arsenal History |accessdate=29 May 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/theo-walcott/ |title=Theo Walcott |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |accessdate=22 June 2017}} If necessary, select season required from below "My year" subheading. against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 14 December. He scored twice against City, but could not prevent Arsenal from losing the match 6–3.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25275712 |title=Man City 6–3 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |first=Phil |last=McNulty |date=14 December 2013 |accessdate=6 January 2014}} On 26 December, his two goals against West Ham United included the first headed goal of his club career.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10537626/West-Ham-United-1-Arsenal-3-match-report.html |title=West Ham United 1 Arsenal 3: match report |first=Matt |last=Law |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} Walcott injured a knee late in the [[FA Cup]] third-round tie against Tottenham Hotspur at the Emirates Stadium in January 2014. In response to abuse from the area holding the visiting fans while he was being stretchered off, Walcott made a hand gesture that reflected the 2–0 scoreline, and he and the stretcher-bearers were pelted with coins and other missiles thrown from that area. The Football Association "reminded him of his responsibilities", but took no further action.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/05/arsenal-tottenham-fac-cup-match-report |title=Fluent Arsenal revel in Theo Walcott's sign language against Tottenham |first=David |last=Hytner |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=5 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/theo-walcott-ambulance-workers-who-were-pelted-with-coins-while-helping-arsenal-forward-were-9044108.html |title=Theo Walcott: Ambulance workers who were pelted with coins while helping Arsenal forward were Tottenham fans |first=Jack |last=de Menezes |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=7 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} The injury, a [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|ruptured anterior cruciate ligament]] of his left knee, meant he was ruled out for at least six months, so would miss the rest of the season and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/06/theo-walcott-out-for-world-cup-arsenal-england-knee |title=Arsenal's Theo Walcott ruled out for season and World Cup with injury |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=7 January 2014 |accessdate=29 May 2017}} ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Arsenal FA Cup Winners Parade (18163649799).jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott (right) at Arsenal's [[2014–15 FA Cup]] winner's parade]] On 1 November 2014, Walcott came off the bench in the 81st minute during a 3–0 [[2014–15 Premier League|Premier League]] home victory against Burnley for his first Gunners appearance in ten months.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29768015 |title=Arsenal 3, Burnley 0 |publisher= BBC Sport |date=1 November 2014 |accessdate= 2 November 2014}} He made his first start of the season against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in the third round of the [[2014–15 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 4 January 2015, exactly a year after sustaining his injury at the same stage of the competition.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30614334|title=Arsenal 2–0 Hull|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 25 January, Walcott scored his first goal of [[2014–15 Arsenal F.C. season|2014–15 campaign]] in the second minute of Arsenal's 3–2 FA Cup fourth-round win at [[Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/25/brighton-arsenal-fa-cup-match-report|title=Brighton 2–3 Arsenal|accessdate=26 January 2015|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} In February 2015, Walcott scored in successive home league victories. On 1 February 2015, Walcott netted in a 5–0 defeat of Aston Villa,{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30971833 | title=Arsenal 5–0 Aston Villa| publisher=BBC Sport | date=1 February 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} before scoring what proved to be the winner in a 2–1 win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] nine days later.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31106369 | title=Arsenal 2–1 Leicester City | publisher=BBC Sport | date=10 February 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} On 17 May 2015, Walcott's deflected shot, which was registered as a [[Tyler Blackett]] own goal, rescued a point in a 1–1 draw at Manchester United.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32679743 | title=Manchester United 1–1 | publisher=BBC Sport | date=17 May 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} One week later, in Arsenal's final match of the Premier League season, Walcott scored a 34-minute hat-trick against West Bromwich Albion at the Emirates Stadium.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32770845|title=Arsenal 4–1 West Brom|date=24 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 30 May, Walcott was selected to start at centre forward for Arsenal in the [[2015 FA Cup Final]], scoring the opening goal in the team's 4–0 victory against Aston Villa.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32856754 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 May 2015 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Theo Walcott 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Walcott playing for Arsenal in 2015]] Ahead of the new season, it was announced that Walcott had extended his contract with Arsenal after prolonged negotiations.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/20893347|title=Theo Walcott & Santi Cazorla sign Arsenal contract extensions|date=31 July 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}} Walcott netted twice in pre-season in wins against Everton and [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]], as Arsenal won the [[2015 Premier League Asia Trophy|Premier League Asia Trophy]] and the [[2015 Emirates Cup|Emirates Cup]].{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/everton-1-3-Arsenal | title=Everton 1–3 Arsenal | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=18 July 2015| accessdate=9 August 2015}}{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/arsenal-v-wolfsburg-match-report | title=Arsenal 1–0 Wolfsburg | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=26 July 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} He began the [[2015–16 Arsenal F.C. season|2015–16]] season starting at centre forward and assisting Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's winning goal in the 1–0 defeat of Chelsea in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]] on 2 August 2015.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33667216 |title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea |first=Andy |last=Cryer |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2015 |accessdate=8 December 2017}}{{cite web | url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/56495/arsenal-v-chelsea-match-report | title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea | publisher=Arsenal F.C. | date=2 August 2015 | accessdate=9 August 2015}} On 12 September, Walcott scored his first goal of the season in a 2–0 home victory against Stoke City in the [[2015–16 Premier League]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34160767|title=Arsenal 2–0 Stoke|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 September 2015}} He netted three more times in September,{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20150930/walcott-is-vitality-player-of-the-month |title=Walcott is Vitality Player of the Month |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=30 September 2015}} including the opener in a 5–2 league win at Leicester City{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299596|title=Leicester 2–5 Arsenal|publisher=BBC|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}} and in back-to-back [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] defeats to Dinamo Zagreb and Olympiacos, the latter of which he picked up an assist for an [[Alexis Sánchez]] header.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34203643|title=Dinamo Zagreb 2–1 Arsenal|publisher=BBC|date=16 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34382802|title=Arsenal 2–3 Olympiakos|publisher=BBC|date=29 September 2015|accessdate=4 October 2015}} His performances saw him voted Arsenal Supporters' Player of the Month for September. He registered another two assists in a 3–0 home league win over Manchester United on 4 October.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34372498 | title=Arsenal 3–0 Man Utd | publisher=BBC | date=4 October 2015 | accessdate=22 December 2015}} On 21 December, Walcott opened the scoring in a 2–1 league defeat of Manchester City at The Emirates.{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35089795|title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City|date=21 December 2015}} On 8 March, Walcott scored a brace in a 4–0 away victory over Hull City in a [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup replay]]{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35693501|title=Hull City 0–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/blog/the-match/60/post/2824667/arsenal-strikers-end-drought-in-welcomed-fa-cup-win-at-hull|title=Jolly: Welcome win for Arsenal at Hull|publisher=ESPN |accessdate=11 March 2016}} ====2016–17 season==== Walcott started Arsenal's opening match against Liverpool, in which he missed a penalty after being brought down by [[Alberto Moreno]], however, he made-up for his earlier miss by scoring Arsenal's opener, however Arsenal still lost the match 3–4.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37001073|first= Saj |last=Chowdhury |title=Arsenal 3–4 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 August 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}} Walcott scored his second goal of the season and his 100th career goal after linking up with [[Alex Iwobi]] to chip the ball over Hull City goalkeeper [[Eldin Jakupović]] to score Arsenal's second goal in a 4–1 win.{{cite web|first=Josh| last=James| url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1617/post/first-team/hull-city-v-arsenal-report |title=Hull City 1–4 Arsenal |publisher=Arsenal F.C. |date=17 September 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}}{{cite web|last=Abraham |first=Timothy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37326798 |title=Hull City 1–4 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 September 2016 |accessdate=24 September 2016}} He then netted his first [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] goals of the season with a brace in a 2–0 win over [[FC Basel|Basel]] on 30 September.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/28/arsenal-basel-champions-league-match-report|title=Theo Walcott at the double in comfortable Arsenal win against Basel|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|date=28 September 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=30 September 2016}} On 17 December 2016, Walcott scored the opening goal of a 2–1 loss at Manchester City before being substituted with a calf injury.{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-returns-arsenal-ahead-9703688|title=Theo Walcott returns for Arsenal ahead of FA Cup fourth round tie against former club Southampton|date=27 January 2017|newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}} He returned on 28 January 2017, scoring a hat-trick against former club Southampton in the fourth round of the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] at [[St. Mary's Stadium]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jan/28/southampton-arsenal-fa-cup-match-report|title=Arsenal's Danny Welbeck and Theo Walcott run riot against Southampton|date=29 January 2017|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}} He scored his 100th goal for Arsenal on 20 February in the next round of the FA Cup in a 2–0 victory over [[Sutton United F.C.|Sutton United]].{{cite news|first1=Jason|last1=Burt|first2=Rob|last2=Bagchi|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/02/20/sutton-united-vs-arsenal-fa-cup-live-score/|title=Sutton United 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott brings up his century to set up quarter-final against Lincoln City|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=20 February 2017|accessdate=1 March 2017}} On 5 April, Walcott captained Arsenal to a 3–0 win in their league match at The Emirates against London rivals West Ham United; he scored the second goal,{{cite web|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title=Arsenal 3–0 West Ham United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39426761|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 April 2017|date=5 April 2017}} which was his 19th and last of the season and took his total to 104. He was an unused substitute as Arsenal beat Chelsea 2–1 in the [[2017 FA Cup Final]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39984089 |title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2017 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} ====2017–18 season==== With the scores tied at 1–1 after normal time, Walcott converted his kick as Arsenal beat Chelsea 4–1 on penalties to win the [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017 Community Shield]],{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40766983 |title=Arsenal 1–1 Chelsea |first=Tom |last=Rostance |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=8 December 2017}} but throughout his last season at Arsenal, he was mainly used in the [[Europa League]] and in the [[EFL Cup]], and he only made 6 substitute appearances in the Premier League. By October, he was increasingly on the fringes at Arsenal,{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/20/theo-walcott-confident-can-work-way-back-englands-world-cupteam/ |title=Theo Walcott confident he can work way back into England's World Cup team |first=Sam |last=Dean |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=20 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} and was criticised following a poor performance when made captain in a 2–1 League Cup victory at home to Championship side [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/arsenal/359/blog/post/3242666/supersub-eddie-nketiah-starsjack-wilshere-gets-7-10-as-arsenal-avoid-norwich-slip |title=Eddie Nketiah stars, Jack Wilshere gets 7/10 as Arsenal avoid Norwich slip |first=James |last=McNicholas |publisher=ESPN |date=24 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} with Arsenal's second highest goalscorer [[Ian Wright]] suggesting that for Walcott's own good, he needed to leave the club,{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11097474/theo-walcott-should-leave-arsenal-says-ian-wright-on-the-debate |title=Theo Walcott should leave Arsenal, says Ian Wright on The Debate |publisher=Sky Sports |date=25 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} a view with which Wenger disagreed.{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/11099424/theo-walcott-still-wanted-at-arsenal-says-arsene-wenger |title=Theo Walcott still wanted at Arsenal, says Arsene Wenger |first=James |last=Dale |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 October 2017 |accessdate=17 November 2017}} Walcott did score 4 goals during his last season at the club, against [[Doncaster Rovers]] in the League Cup {{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249728|title=Arsenal 1–0 Doncaster Rovers|date=20 September 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}}, and 3 in the [[2017–18_UEFA_Europa_League_group_stage#Group_H|Europa League group stage]], all coming against [[BATE Borisov]], with 2 away{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000890/match=2022053/index.html#/|title=UEFA Europa League – BATE-Arsenal|first=|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com}}, and 1 at home{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000890/match=2022149/index.html#/|title=UEFA Europa League – Arsenal-BATE|first=|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com}}. ===Everton=== On 17 January 2018, Walcott signed a three-and-a-half-year contract with Everton in what the BBC reported as "a deal worth more than £20m".{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42715223 |title=Theo Walcott: Everton sign forward from Arsenal |first=David |last=Ornstein |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2018 |accessdate=26 January 2018}} He made his debut for the club three days later, providing the assist for [[Oumar Niasse]]'s equaliser in a 1–1 draw at home to West Bromwich Albion in the Premier League.{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/20/everton-west-brom-premier-league-report |title=Oumar Niasse's volley earns draw for listless Everton against West Brom |first=Nick |last=Ames |newspaper=The Observer |location=London |date=20 January 2018 |accessdate=26 January 2018}} He then recorded a [[2 (number)#In sports|brace]] in his next match, a 2–1 win over Leicester.{{cite news |title=Theo Walcott ends Everton's winless run with double against Leicester |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/31/everton-leicester-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=2 February 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=31 Jan 2018}} ==International career== ===2006 World Cup=== On 8 May 2006, Walcott was surprisingly named in [[Sven-Göran Eriksson]]'s [[2006 FIFA World Cup squads#England|squad]] for the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]],{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/4983618.stm|title=Walcott & Lennon in England squad|date=8 May 2006|accessdate=15 August 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} despite having only made 13 appearances in senior football and making none since joining [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-385548/Theo-Walcott-Ten-things-didnt-know.html|title=Theo Walcott: Ten things you didn't know|date=9 May 2006|accessdate=15 August 2013|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} Even with first-choice strikers [[Wayne Rooney]] and Michael Owen both recovering from injury, Walcott was selected over established Premier League strikers [[Darren Bent]] (the highest-scoring English forward in the Premier League in the [[2005–06 Premier League|2005–06 season]]), [[Andrew Johnson (English footballer)|Andrew Johnson]] (the top English goalscorer in the Premier League in the [[2004–05 Premier League|2004–05 season]]), [[Dean Ashton]] (like Bent, already an established player at [[England national under-21 football team|England Under-21]] level) and [[Jermain Defoe]]. On 25 May 2006, Walcott came on as a second-half substitute for the [[England national football B team|England B]] team against [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/5017924.stm |title=England B 1–2 Belarus |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 May 2006 |accessdate=27 November 2017}} On 30 May 2006, he became [[England national football team records|England's youngest ever senior player]] by appearing in a 3–1 [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] win over [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]] at [[Old Trafford]] aged 17 years and 75 days. Despite being one of only two fully fit strikers in the England squad (the other being [[Peter Crouch]]), he did not play during the tournament. Eriksson defended his decision, claiming that the experience would serve Walcott well for future tournaments.{{cite news | date=2 July 2006| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/5139428.stm | title=Eriksson defends Walcott choice |publisher=BBC Sport | accessdate=7 July 2006 | first=Phil | last=McNulty}} After the World Cup, Eriksson stepped down as England manager. New appointment [[Steve McClaren]] put Walcott into the England Under-21s, claiming he was "toughening up" on his squad selections. ===2007 and 2009 Under-21 European Championships=== On 15 August 2006, Walcott became the youngest player ever to score for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] when he scored the opener after three minutes in England's 2–2 draw with [[Moldova national under-21 football team|Moldova]] at Ipswich Town's ground [[Portman Road]]. The match against Moldova was his first cap for the England under-21s.{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/gossip_and_transfers/4778613.stm |publisher=BBC Sport | title=Thursday's gossip column | date=10 August 2006 | accessdate=25 May 2010}} Walcott scored two goals against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] to seal qualification for England to the [[2007 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|Under-21 European Championship]], in the playoff second leg in October 2006, with his second drawing comparisons with Thierry Henry.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,30849-2398754,00.html |date=11 October 2006|title=Wizardry of Walcott puts Germany under a spell |newspaper=The Times |accessdate=8 December 2006 | location=London | first=Peter | last=Lansley}} Over the summer of 2009, Walcott participated in England under-21 team's [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] campaign despite protestations from his club manager, Arsène Wenger. Wenger complained that Walcott's participation in the tournament as well as matches with the senior squad would lead to burn out and injury.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/arsenal/8067214.stm |title= Wenger fear over Walcott workload |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 May 2009 }} England reached the final of the U21 Euros, where they lost 4–0 to Germany, with Walcott thus earning a silver medal as a runner-up.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/5690126/England-U21-0-Germany-U21-4-match-report.html |title=England U21 0 Germany U21 4: Match report |first=Henry |last=Winter |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=29 June 2009 |accessdate=23 December 2017}} ===2010 World Cup Qualification and omission from Finals=== On 6 September 2008, Walcott made his first competitive start in a World Cup qualifier against [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]],{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1052695/Capello-wields-axe-Becks-Walcott-set-England-start-Andorra.html|title=Capello wields axe on Becks: Walcott set for England start|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} and in the following match against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] on 10 September he opened his senior international goals tally and became the youngest player in history to score a hat-trick for England. In doing so, Walcott also became the first England player to score a hat-trick in a competitive match since Michael Owen in 2001.{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Stevenson |title=Croatia 1–4 England |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/7602774.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 September 2008 |accessdate=15 June 2016}} Walcott returned to the international fold on 3 March 2010 in a friendly against [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]]. It was his first international start for nine months.{{cite news |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article7049298.ece |title=Theo Walcott does not understand football, says Chris Waddle |author=Smith, Ben |date=4 March 2010 |newspaper=The Times |accessdate=30 May 2010 |location=London}} He faded after a bright start{{cite news |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/750456/ce/uk/?campaign=rss&source=soccernet&cc=4716&ver=global |title=Waddle unimpressed with Walcott |date=4 March 2010 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=30 May 2010}} and was replaced by [[Shaun Wright-Phillips]] after 57 minutes as England recovered from a goal down to beat Egypt 3–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]]. His performance came under heavy criticism from [[Chris Waddle]] who said of Walcott, "I've never seen him develop. He just doesn't understand the game for me – where to be running, when to run inside a full back, when to just play a one-two. It's all off the cuff. I just don't think he's got a football brain and he's going to have problems. Let's be honest, good defenders would catch him offside every time." Walcott started England's friendly victories against Mexico and [[Japan national football team|Japan]] in May 2010.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8699042.stm|title=England 3–1 Mexico|publisher=BBC Sport}}{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8712673.stm|title=Japan 1–2 England|publisher=BBC Sport}} However, on 1 June 2010, it was announced that Walcott had been left out of England's 23-man World Cup squad by [[Fabio Capello]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/8713742.stm |title=World Cup 2010: Walcott left out of England squad |date=1 June 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 June 2010}} On 4 July, a few days after England's exit from the World Cup, [[Lionel Messi]] said that he was shocked by Walcott's exclusion as he believed that Walcott could have made the difference against Germany and [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]].{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/805925/ce/uk/?cc=4716&ver=global |title=World Cup 2010: Messi shocked by Walcott's axe |date=4 July 2010 |publisher=ESPNsoccernet |accessdate=4 July 2010}} In January 2011, Capello admitted that he had made a mistake in not selecting Walcott for the 2010 World Cup.{{cite news |url= https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/i-should-have-taken-theo-walcott-to-the-world-cup-admits-fabio-capello-vdppp2t65zc|title=I should have taken Theo Walcott to World Cup, admits Fabio Capello|date=28 January 2011|first=Oliver|last=Kay|newspaper= The Times|location=London}} ===Euro 2012=== In the [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifying]] match against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] on 7 September 2010, Walcott was stretchered off after he was clipped in the build-up to Wayne Rooney's opener for England after 10 minutes{{cite news|title= England winger Theo Walcott has X-ray on ankle injury|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8978359.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 September 2010|date=7 September 2010}} putting him out of action for several weeks.{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2148973,00.html |title=Walcott blow for Gunners |date=9 September 2010 |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226184512/http://origin-www.premierleague.com/page/Headlines/0,,12306~2148973,00.html |archivedate=26 February 2014 |df=dmy-all }} At [[UEFA Euro 2012]], Walcott appeared for England as a second-half substitute in the group match against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]]. Shortly after coming on, Walcott scored to bring the match level at 2–2. Less than 15 minutes later, he provided the cross for [[Danny Welbeck]]'s 74th-minute winner in England's 3–2 victory.{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |title=Sweden 2–3 England |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18181790 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2012 |accessdate=15 June 2016}} Afterwards, England manager Roy Hodgson praised Walcott's "enormous" impact on the match, while [[Lee Dixon]] on the BBC said Walcott had "changed the game".{{cite news|title=Euro 2012: Walcott's impact was 'enormous' – Roy Hodgson|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18467617|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 June 2012}}{{cite news|title=Euro 2012-day eight analysis: How Walcott saved England|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18462729|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 June 2012}} Walcott also played in the final group match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] which England won 1–0.{{cite news| first= Phil | last= McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/18181971|title=England 1–0 Ukraine|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 June 2012|accessdate=30 October 2016}} ===2014 World Cup Qualifying=== Walcott started in England's 5–0 win against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]], but was injured in an early clash with the goalkeeper [[Aldo Junior Simoncini|Aldo Simoncini]]. After treatment on the touchline, he was substituted for [[Aaron Lennon]], and then taken to hospital as a precaution, where he underwent "scans and tests" according to England manager [[Roy Hodgson]],{{cite news|last=Paul|first=Kelso|title=England v San Marino: Roy Hodgson fumes as Theo Walcott is cut down by goalkeeper's reckless tackle |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/england/9606149/England-v-San-Marino-Roy-Hodgson-fumes-as-Theo-Walcott-is-cut-down-by-goalkeepers-reckless-tackle.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=17 October 2012|date=12 October 2012}} Walcott was later ruled out of England's next match against [[Poland national football team|Poland]], he did not start a match in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|qualifiers]] until almost a year later on 6 September, when he played the full 90 minutes in the 4–0 win against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]], he also played 87 minutes in the following match against Ukraine, which ended in a 0–0 draw, but he was injured before England's match against [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] and he was still out against Poland, which England won 2–0 to qualify for the 2014 FIFA World Cup, in Brazil.{{citation needed|date=April 2017}} ===Euro 2016 omission and World Cup 2018 qualifying=== Having missed out on the 2014 World Cup through injury, Walcott was not selected by Roy Hodgson for the 26-man provisional [[Euro 2016]] squad announced in May 2016. Hodgson commented, "Theo unfortunately has not got such a regular match over the last few months and has had a few problems with injury. It's a tough decision but it's one you have to take."{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/england-euro-2016-squad-marcus-rashford-jack-wilshere-andros-townsend-jordan-henderson|title=Marcus Rashford and Andros Townsend in provisional England Euro 2016 squad|last=Nakrani|first=Sachin|date=16 May 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 March 2017}} Walcott was informed by England manager [[Gareth Southgate]] on 16 March 2017, his 28th birthday, that he was being dropped from the squad to play a friendly against Germany and a [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] qualifier against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]], despite scoring 17 goals in 29 appearances in all club competitions during the 2016–17 season.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/mar/16/theo-walcott-dropped-gareth-southgate-england|title=Happy birthday, Theo, you're dropped – England bombshell for Walcott|date=16 March 2017|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 March 2017}} Southgate said that Walcott had not transferred his early season form into the England matches against [[Malta national football team|Malta]] and [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]] in October 2016 and [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in November 2016. ==Style of play== Walcott is well known for his rapid pace,{{cite news | date=23 December 2009| url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-shatters-thierry-henrys-3368956|first=John |last=Cross| title=Theo Walcott shatters Thierry Henry's Arsenal record| newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=26 August 2011}} with former Barcelona manager Pep Guardiola declaring that "you would need a pistol to stop him."{{cite news | date=6 April 2010| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/arsenal/article7088349.ece|first=Oliver |last=Kay| title=Theo Walcott's pace plants seed of uncertainty in Barcelona's minds| newspaper=The Times |location=London | accessdate=29 January 2011}} He has been likened by Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger to the club's all-time leading scorer, Thierry Henry.{{cite news | date=3 November 2010| url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/54165.html| title=Wenger expects Walcott to emulate Henry | publisher=ESPN UK | accessdate=29 January 2011}} [[FIFA World Player of the Year]] winner Lionel Messi has described Walcott as "one of the most dangerous players I have ever played against."{{cite news |url= http://soccernet.espn.go.com/world-cup/story/_/id/805925/ce/uk/?cc=4716&ver=global |title=World Cup 2010: Messi shocked by Walcott's axe |date=4 July 2010 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=29 January 2011}} In addition to his speed, Walcott also possesses good balance, movement and technique.{{cite web|last=Marcotti|first=Gabriele|title=Arsenal misread situation with Walcott|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/feature/_/id/1145547/marcotti:-arsenal-misread-situation-with-walcott-?cc=5901|work=Sports Illustrated|accessdate=29 August 2012}} ==Outside football== [[File:David Yates New York 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Theo's aunt Yvonne Walcott with her husband [[David Yates]]]] ===Personal life=== His family made a cameo appearance in the 2007 film ''[[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix]]'', directed by [[David Yates]], the partner of Walcott's aunt.{{cite web|url=http://www.snitchseeker.com/harry-potter-news/actress-melanie-slade-talks-filming-half-blood-prince-updated-62536/|title=Actress Melanie Slade talks filming Half-Blood Prince |publisher=snitchseeker.com|date=27 February 2009| accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite news |first=Henry|last=Deedes |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/pandora/pandora-standard-opera-row-has-a-dramatic-finish-1633413.html|title=Pandora: 'Standard' opera row has a dramatic finish|newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=27 February 2009 |accessdate=8 March 2017}} Walcott himself was due to appear as well, but his commitments to Arsenal forced him to drop out.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2093-2372152,00.html|date=24 September 2006|title=Football Shorts: Theo misses out on Harry Potter film|newspaper=The Times|accessdate=24 October 2006 | location=London|first=Fiona|last=Hamilton}} His cousin [[Jacob Walcott]] was a trainee at Reading{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u16s/news/2009/jacobwalcott |date=29 November 2007|title=Following in Theo's footsteps |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=22 February 2014|first=Russell|last= Staves}} and a member of the [[England national under-17 football team]] appearing in the [[2009 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]].{{cite web|url=http://sv.cd.uefa.com/under17/season=2009/matches/round=15207/match=2001160/index.html |date=6 May 2009 |title=Garbutt hits back as England hold Dutch |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301184158/http://sv.cd.uefa.com/under17/season=2009/matches/round=15207/match=2001160/index.html |archivedate=1 March 2014 }} His older sister, Hollie, is a bodybuilder who came second in the British Natural Bodybuilding Federation Central Championships in July 2010.{{cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2010/08/09/theos-sister-hollie-walcott-in-uk-bodybuilder-championships-473787/|newspaper=Metro|location=London |title=Hollie Walcott|date=9 August 2010}} Walcott has been in a long-term relationship with Melanie Slade, after meeting in 2004 at the [[WestQuay]] shopping centre in Southampton.{{cite news|first= Carole|last=Cadwalladr|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2006/jun/04/worldcup2006.sport37 |date= 4 June 2006 |title=Meet the real footballers' wives |newspaper=The Guardian |accessdate=27 March 2009 | location=London}} The couple married at the [[Castello di Vincigliata]] in Tuscany, Italy, in June 2013.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2347083/Arsenal-star-Theo-Walcott-ties-knot-childhood-sweetheart-Melanie-Slade.html|title=Theo Walcott ties the knot with childhood sweetheart Melanie Slade|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=24 June 2013|accessdate=24 June 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}} Their first son Finley James Walcott was born on 10 April 2014,{{cite news |title=Theo Walcott shows off handsome newborn son in first photo |url=http://www.hellomagazine.com/healthandbeauty/mother-and-baby/2014041318164/theo-walcott-baby-photo-melanie-slade/ |magazine=Hello! |accessdate=14 April 2014|date=13 April 2014}} with their second son, Arlo, being born on 26 November 2016.{{cite news |last1=Bhardwaj|first1=Vaishali|title=Arsenal star Theo Walcott becomes father for second time after welcoming second boy into the world |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/arsenal-star-theo-walcott-becomes-father-for-second-time-after-welcoming-second-boy-into-the-world-a3405656.html|accessdate=27 November 2016 |newspaper=London Evening Standard|date=26 November 2016}} Walcott has been involved with the UK charities Build a School{{cite news | title= Charity celebrates year of success | newspaper=Harrow Times |author=Kirk, Tristan | url= http://www.harrowtimes.co.uk/display.var.1773429.0.0.php|date = 21 October 2007|accessdate=11 September 2008}} and Best Beginnings.{{cite web | title= Fundraising film |publisher=YouTube | url= https://www.youtube.com/bbshorts|date = May 2009|accessdate=27 May 2009}} He also has a pie named in his honour at the Arsenal pie shop in [[Holloway, London|Holloway]], which won a gold award at the British Pie Awards of 2015.{{cite news|first=Rory|last= Brigstock-Barron |url=http://www.islingtongazette.co.uk/news/walcott_on_the_menu_at_famous_arsenal_pie_shop_in_holloway_1_4058624|title=Walcott on the menu at famous Arsenal pie shop in Holloway|newspaper=Islington Gazette |location=London |date=3 May 2015|accessdate=8 March 2017}} On 6 April 2008, Walcott was a torchbearer for the [[Olympic Flame]] for [[Beijing 2008]] as it was paraded around London. He was the penultimate torchbearer just before [[Kelly Holmes|Dame Kelly Holmes]].{{cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/goingout/attractions/where-to-see-the-olympic-torch-in-london-7247139.html|title=Where to see the Olympic torch in London|newspaper=Evening Standard |location=London |date=3 April 2008|accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/london/content/articles/2008/03/04/olympic_torch_feature.shtml|title=Olympic Torch Relay in London|publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 April 2008|accessdate=8 March 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.supersport.com/football/football-features/news/100824/EPL_Player_of_the_Week_Walcott|title=EPL Player of the Week-Walcott|publisher=Super Sport.com|date=24 August 2010|accessdate=8 March 2017}} ===Endorsements=== When Walcott was 14 years old, he signed an endorsement deal with American sportswear and equipment supplier, Nike. In November 2012 he appeared in an advert for the new Nike Green Speed II alongside [[Eden Hazard]] and [[Raheem Sterling]].{{cite news | url = http://www.footballboots.co.uk/7958-theo-walcott-nike-gs-2.html | title = Theo Walcott Wears the Nike GS2 | publisher = Football Boots |date=23 November 2012| accessdate = 26 November 2012 }} In February 2015, Walcott announced a new sponsorship deal with [[Adidas]].{{cite web|url=http://www.footyheadlines.com/2015/02/theo-walcott-joins-adidas.html|title=Theo Walcott joins Adidas|website=Footy Headlines.com|date=20 February 2015|accessdate=9 February 2017}} Walcott appeared in an advert for Adidas in August 2016, showing off his skills in dribbling and flicking a ball into the open top of a wheelie bin.{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/theo-walcott-scores-bin-adidas-8541776|first =Mick|last=Gadd|title=Theo Walcott scores in a bin for adidas but still chasing first Arsenal goal of the pre-season|newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=1 August 2016 |accessdate=9 February 2017}} Walcott features in EA Sports' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game series. One of his [[goal celebration]]s – ‘pat-a-cake’ dance with [[Mesut Özil]] – appears in ''[[FIFA 14]]''.[https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/fifa-14-celebrations-how-gareth-2268393 "Fifa 14 celebrations: How to do Gareth Bale, Ronaldo, and Lionel Messi's signature moves"]. ''The Mirror''. Retrieved September 6, 2014{{cite news |title=The Evolution of EA Sport's FIFA 14 Video Game |url=https://abcnews.go.com/ABC_Univision/ABC_Univision/evolution-ea-sports-fifa-14-video-game/story?id=20028621 |accessdate=29 September 2018 |agency=ABC News}} ===Books=== Walcott currently has four published books – "''T.J. and the Hat-Trick''", "''T.J. and the Penalty''", "''T.J. and the Winning Goal''" and "''T.J. and the Cup Run''". The first two were published in April 2010, with the latter two being published in August 2010. All four were published by [[Corgi Books|Corgi Children's]].{{cite web|title=Theo Walcott Bibliography |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=theo+walcott&sprefix=theo+walcott |publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=17 August 2011}} In August 2011, Walcott's autobiography ''Theo: Growing Up Fast'' was published by [[Bantam Press]].{{cite book |last=Walcott |first=Theo |title=Theo: Growing Up Fast |year=2011 |publisher=Bantam Press |isbn=0-593-06459-3 |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/0593064593}} The book caused controversy because of his criticism of England manager Fabio Capello, whom he describes as "cold and clinical".{{cite news|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|title=Theo Walcott criticises Fabio Capello's World Cup preparations in book|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/15/walcott-criticises-capello-book|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=17 August 2011|date=15 August 2011}} ==Career statistics== {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Lucas Digne | image = Save the Dream at the Match of Champions (31760339442) (cropped).jpg | image_size = 150 | caption = Digne lining up for [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in 2016 | fullname = Lucas Digne<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|7|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Meaux]], France | height = 1.78 m | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Left-back]] | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 12 | youthyears1 = 1999–2002 | youthclubs1 = Mareuil-sur-Ourcq | youthyears2 = 2002–2005 | youthclubs2 = Crépy-en-Valois | youthyears3 = 2005–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] | years1 = 2010–2011 | clubs1 = [[Lille OSC|Lille B]] | caps1 = 36 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2011–2013 | clubs2 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] | caps2 = 49 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2013–2016 | clubs3 = [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] | caps3 = 29 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = → [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] (loan) | caps4 = 33 | goals4 = 3 | years5 = 2016–2018 | clubs5 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps5 = 29 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps6 = 25 | goals6 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-16 football team|France U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 15 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 15 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam3 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam4 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 12 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2013 | nationalteam5 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 12 | nationalgoals5 = 2 | nationalyears6 = 2013 | nationalteam6 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 7 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2014– | nationalteam7 = [[France national football team|France]] | nationalcaps7 = 23 | nationalgoals7 = 0 | club-update = 13:30, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 17:54, 26 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Lucas Digne''' ({{IPA-fr|lykɑ diɲ}}; born 20 July 1993) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]] for English {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[France national football team|France national team]].
Digne began his career at [[Lille OSC|Lille]] before joining [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] in 2013. After spending a season on loan at [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], he moved to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in July 2016. Despite not playing regularly at either club, he won 12 honours at Paris and Barcelona combined. He joined Everton in August 2018.
He won the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2013 World Cup]] with [[France national under-20 football team|France under-20]], and made his senior international debut in March 2014. He represented [[France national football team|France]] at [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]], where his nation reached the final.
==Club career== ===Lille=== [[File:Lucas Digne (LOSC).JPG|thumb|left|upright|Digne playing for [[Lille OSC|Lille]] in 2012]] Born in [[Meaux]], [[Seine-et-Marne]], Digne finished his development at [[Lille OSC|Lille]], signing his first professional contract on 27 July 2010 for three years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.losc.fr/filInfo.php?id=2835 |title=Digne et le LOSC liés jusqu'en 2013 |date=27 July 2010 |work=[[Lille OSC]] |accessdate=2 August 2010 |language=French}}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Ahead of the [[2011–12 Ligue 1|2011–12 season]], Digne was promoted to the senior team permanently and assigned the number 3 shirt. He made his professional debut on 26 October 2011 in a 6–1 victory over [[CS Sedan Ardennes|Sedan]] in the last 16 of the [[Coupe de la Ligue]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/75645 |title=Lille v. Sedan Match Report |date=6 October 2011 |work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |accessdate=26 October 2011 |language=French}}</ref>
In January 2012, Digne extended his contract until 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lucas Digne prolonge à Lille |trans-title=Lucas Digne prolongs at Lille |url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/ligue-1/Homes-Clubs/lille/fil-info/lucas-digne-prolonge-a-lille-527131 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |work=Le Figaro |date=10 January 2012 |language=French}}</ref> On 28 January, he made his [[Ligue 1]] debut at the [[Stadium Nord Lille Metropole]], playing the final two minutes of a 3–0 win over [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Les Dogues passent au vert ! |trans-title=The ''Dogues'' go at the green! |url=https://www.losc.fr/actualites-foot-lille/losc-asse-3-0-les-dogues-passent-au-vert |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=Lille OSC |date=28 January 2012 |language=Spanish}}</ref> He totalled 16 league appearances as the defending champions came third.
Digne was a regular in the 2012–13 season. On 23 February 2013, having given Lille the lead in a 3–1 win at [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]] when his cross was deflected in by [[Yoann Poulard]], he was sent off after an hour for a foul on [[Matthieu Chalmé]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ten-man Lille ease to victory |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/ac-ajaccio-vs-lille/259888 |accessdate=1 August 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=23 February 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal on 7 April, a penalty in a 5–0 home win over [[FC Lorient|Lorient]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Kalou at the double for Lille |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/lille-vs-lorient/284955 |accessdate=1 August 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=7 April 2013}}</ref> and two weeks later he added another to equalise in a 2–1 comeback victory at [[SC Bastia|Bastia]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Lille fight back at Bastia |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/bastia-vs-lille/260036 |accessdate=1 August 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 April 2013}}</ref>
===Paris Saint-Germain=== On 17 July 2013, Digne signed a five-year deal with [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.psg.fr/en/News/003001/Article/62873/Lucas-Digne-signs-five-year-deal-with-Paris-Saint-Germain |title=LUCAS DIGNE SIGNS FIVE-YEAR DEAL WITH PARIS SAINT-GERMAIN |date=17 July 2013 |accessdate=17 July 2013 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C.}}</ref> on a fee believed to be around €15 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/69/transfer-zone/2013/07/17/4124637/paris-saint-germain-seals-digne-deal |title=Paris Saint-Germain seals Digne deal |date=17 July 2013 |accessdate=17 July 2013 |publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> On 3 August, he was an unused substitute as they won the [[2013 Trophée des Champions]] with a 2–1 victory over [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] in Gabon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Paris Saint-Germain 2–1 Girondins de Bordeaux |url=https://www.lfp.fr/tropheeChampions/feuille_match/78274 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=LFP |date=3 August 2013}}</ref> He did not make his debut until 13 September in a 2–0 win at the same opponents, as manager [[Laurent Blanc]] rotated his squad ahead of the [[UEFA Champions League]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Digne to get his chance in Bordeaux? |url=https://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/digne-to-get-his-chance-in-bordeaux.htm |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=Ligue 1 |date=10 September 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Digne et Ongenda titulaires avec le PSG à Bordeaux|trans-title=Digne and Ongenda starters for PSG at Bordeaux |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/flash-actualite-sports/ligue-1-digne-et-ongenda-titulaires-avec-le-psg-a-bordeaux-13-09-2013-3134467.php |accessdate=31 July 2018 |work=Le Parisien |date=13 September 2013 |language=French}}</ref> PSG ended the season with both the league and league cup titles, though Digne was back-up to Brazilian veteran [[Maxwell (footballer)|Maxwell]].<ref name=four/>
Digne played the full 90 minutes in the [[2014 Trophée des Champions]], which PSG won 2–0 against [[EA Guingamp|Guingamp]] in Beijing.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Maltret |first1=Laurent |title=Paris brille à Pékin |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/match/316940 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |work=L'Équipe |date=2 August 2014 |language=French}}</ref> The Parisians won all four domestic honours in 2014–15, with Digne an unused substitute in their Coupe de France and Coupe de la Ligue final victories.
====Roma (loan)==== On 26 August 2015, Italian [[Serie A]] club [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] signed Digne from PSG on a season-long loan deal for €2.5 million, with the option to make the move permanent at the end of the [[2015–16 A.S. Roma season|season]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.asroma.it/en/news/roma_complete_signing_of_lucas_digne |title=Roma complete signing of Lucas Digne |date=26 August 2015 |publisher=[[A.S. Roma]] |accessdate=26 August 2015}}</ref> He made his debut five days later, playing the entire match in a 2–1 victory against title holders [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] at the [[Stadio Olimpico]]. He blew a sarcastic kiss at opponent [[Roberto Pereyra]] and advised him to check the scoreboard, a gesture likened to one by Roma captain [[Francesco Totti]] to [[Igor Tudor]] of the same rival in a 4–0 win in February 2004.<ref>{{cite news |title=Roma, Digne come Totti: sfottò alla Juve per il risultato |trans-title=Roma, Digne like Totti: teased Juventus for the result |url=https://sport.sky.it/calcio/2015/08/31/digne-come-totti-sfotto-risultato-roma-juve.html |accessdate=2 August 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 August 2015 |language=Italian}}</ref>
Digne scored his first goal for the ''Giallorossi'' on 26 September with a close-range header in a 5–1 home win over [[Carpi F.C. 1909|Carpi]], having earlier assisted [[Kostas Manolas]] in opening his account for the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Roma 5 Carpi 1: Garcia's five-star men leave new boys winless |url=http://www.beinsports.com/en/football/news/roma-5-carpi-1-garcias-five-star-men-leave-1/103943 |accessdate=2 August 2018 |publisher=beIN Sports |date=26 September 2015}}</ref> Against the same opponents on 12 February, he returned from injury to score from 30 metres in a 3–1 win,<ref>{{cite news |title=Le superbe but de Lucas Digne (AS Roma) face à Carpi|trans-title=Lucas Digne's (AS Roma) superb goal against Carpi |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Le-superbe-but-de-lucas-digne-as-roma-face-a-carpi/634098 |accessdate=2 August 2018 |work=L'Équipe |date=12 February 2016 |language=French}}</ref> and on 17 April he opened a 3–3 draw at [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]].<ref>{{cite news |title=10 facts and figures on Atalanta 3–3 Roma |url=http://www.asroma.com/en/news/2016/4/10-facts-and-figures-on-atalanta-3-3-roma |accessdate=2 August 2018 |publisher=AS Roma |date=19 April 2016}}</ref> The team from Italy's [[Rome|capital]] came third in Serie A, and Digne declared that he wanted the move to be made permanent.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Rodden |first1=Mark |title=Paris Saint-Germain defender Lucas Digne wants permanent Roma move |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/soccer-transfers/story/2874642/paris-saint-germain-defender-lucas-digne-wants-permanent-roma-move |accessdate=2 August 2018 |publisher=ESPN FC |date=17 May 2016}}</ref>
===Barcelona=== On 13 July 2016, Digne joined Spanish [[La Liga]] side [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] on a five-year deal. The fee was €16.5 million (£13.8 million), with the possibility to increase to €20.5 million (£17.1 million), according to individual and team results.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2016-2017/lucas-digne-becomes-fc-barcelona-s-latest-signing |title=Lucas Digne becomes FC Barcelona's latest signing |publisher=FC Barcelona |date=13 July 2016 |accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> On 14 August 2016, Digne made his first appearance for Barcelona in a 0–2 victory against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in the [[2016 Supercopa de España]] first leg, as a 27th-minute substitute for compatriot [[Jérémy Mathieu]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.barcablaugranes.com/2016/8/15/12479424/barcelonas-lucas-digne-impresses-on-debut-vs-sevilla |title=Barcelona's Lucas Digne Impresses on Debut vs. Sevilla |last=Mazariegos |first=Luis |date=2016-08-15 |website=Barca Blaugranes|access-date=2016-08-16}}</ref>
He played 26 total games in his first season at the [[Camp Nou]], scoring once in a 7–0 (8–1 aggregate) win over [[Segunda División B]] club [[Hércules CF|Hércules]] in the last 32 of the [[Copa del Rey]] on 21 December 2016.<ref>{{cite news |title=Barcelona 7–0 Hércules |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38339837 |accessdate=29 July 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 December 2016}}</ref> Barcelona won that cup, with Digne unused in the [[2017 Copa del Rey Final|final]] on 27 May 2017, a 3–1 win over [[Deportivo Alavés|Alavés]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Barcelona 3–1 Alaves |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39909498 |accessdate=1 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 May 2017}}</ref>
Digne played 20 times in [[2017–18 FC Barcelona season|2017–18]] as Barcelona won the league and cup [[Double (association football)|double]] under new manager [[Ernesto Valverde]]. On 18 October 2017, he scored from [[Lionel Messi]]'s assist in a 3–1 home win over [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] in the Champions League group stage.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Unwin |first1=Will |title=Barcelona 3–1 Olympiakos: Lionel Messi scores 100th European goal as Gerard Pique sees red |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/barcelona-vs-olympiakos/384284 |accessdate=29 July 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=19 October 2017}}</ref>
===Everton=== Digne joined English club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 1 August 2018, for a five-year deal on an initial fee of £18 million.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lucas Digne: Everton sign full-back from Barcelona for £18m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45024174 |accessdate=1 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 August 2018}}</ref> He made his debut ten days later, replacing double goalscorer and fellow debutant [[Richarlison]] for the last four minutes of a 2–2 draw at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hafez |first1=Shamoon |title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–2 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45067374 |accessdate=11 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018}}</ref> On his first start on 29 August in a 3–1 [[EFL Cup]] win against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]], he assisted a goal from [[Dominic Calvert-Lewin]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Lucas Digne shines on full debut for Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45266834 |accessdate=29 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 August 2018}}</ref> Digne made his first [[Premier League]] start for Everton four days later in a home game against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], and assisted Dominic Calvert-Lewin's headed equaliser in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton maintain their unbeaten start |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45305226 |accessdate=1 September 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2018}}</ref>
By the start of October, Digne had become Everton's first-choice left back, ahead of veteran [[Leighton Baines]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jones |first1=Adam |title=How Lucas Digne has firmly cemented his place in Everton's first team ahead of Leighton Baines |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/how-lucas-digne-firmly-cemented-15241440 |accessdate=24 January 2019 |work=Liverpool Echo |date=5 October 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 10 December, in the sixth minute of stoppage time at the end of a match against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], curling in a free kick for a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lucas Digne first Everton goal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46422266 |accessdate=10 December 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 December 2018}}</ref> Sixteen days later he scored twice in a 5–1 win at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], with a free kick and a 30-yard shot.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lucas Digne at the double |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46615195 |accessdate=26 December 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2018}}</ref> On 29 January 2019 he was sent off in a 1–0 win at Huddersfield for denying [[Adama Diakhaby]] a goalscoring opportunity with a foul.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Begley |first1=Emlyn |title=Huddersfield Town 0–1 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46955252 |accessdate=29 January 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Lucas DIGNE.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Digne with the [[France national under-19 football team|France U19s]] in 2012]]
Digne was a [[France national youth football team|French youth international]] and represented his nation at the [[France national under-16 football team|U16]], [[France national under-17 football team|U17]], and [[France national under-18 football team|U18]] levels. At the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Turkey, he played every match as [[France national under-20 football team|France]] won the title.<ref name=four>{{cite news |last1=Sehdev |first1=Aman |title=Meet the French left-back set to make Patrice Evra sweat for his World Cup place |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/meet-french-left-back-set-make-patrice-evra-sweat-his-world-cup-place |accessdate=31 July 2018 |work=FourFourTwo |date=28 May 2014}}</ref>
He was first called up for the [[France national football team|senior side]] in February 2014, ahead of a friendly match against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] on 5 March.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Absalon |first1=Julien |title=Équipe de France : Digne et Griezmann retenus pour affronter les Pays-Bas |trans-title=France team: Digne and Griezmann retained to face the Netherlands |url=https://www.rtl.fr/sport/equipe-de-france-griezmann-et-digne-retenus-pour-affronter-les-pays-bas-7770054824 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=RTL |date=27 February 2014 |language=French}}</ref> He debuted in that match, as a half-time substitute for [[Patrice Evra]] in a 2–0 win at the [[Stade de France]].<ref>{{cite news |title=International friendly: France ease to a 2–0 win over Holland in Paris |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/france-vs-netherlands/305330 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=6 March 2014}}</ref>
In June, manager [[Didier Deschamps]] named Digne as one of 23 members of the French squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil, wearing the number 17 shirt.<ref>{{cite news |title=France squad for 2014 World Cup: the 23 chosen by Didier Deschamps |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jun/05/france-squad-2014-world-cup |accessdate=31 July 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=5 June 2014}}</ref> His one appearance for the eventual quarter-finalists was the third group game against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]], in which he suffered a foul that earned the Ecuadorian captain [[Antonio Valencia]] a straight red card.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Cruise |first1=Ian |title=Ecuador 0–0 France: Antonio Valencia sees red as South Americans bow out |url=https://talksport.com/football/167607/ecuador-0-0-france-antonio-valencia-sees-red-south-americans-bow-out-14062598379/ |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=Talksport |date=25 June 2014}}</ref>
Digne was chosen for the French squad that came runners-up on home soil at [[UEFA Euro 2016]], but did not play.<ref>{{cite news |title=Euro 2016: Leicester's N'Golo Kante in France squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36282689 |accessdate=31 July 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2016}}</ref> He was put on standby for the squad at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Benson |first1=Michael |title=World Cup 2018: Chelsea, Manchester United and Manchester City stars included in France's squad for finals |url=https://talksport.com/football/world-cup-2018-chelsea-manchester-united-and-manchester-city-stars-included-frances-squad |accessdate=24 May 2018 |publisher=Talksport |date=17 May 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Digne was in [[Barcelona]] when it was [[2017 Barcelona attacks|hit by a terror attack]] on 17 August 2017, and gave first aid to the victims.<ref>{{cite news |title=Barcelona's Lucas Digne aided wounded after deadly attack – sources |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/barcelona/story/3185507/barcelonas-lucas-digne-aided-wounded-after-deadly-attack-sources |accessdate=29 July 2018 |publisher=ESPN FC |date=21 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Digne gave first aid to Barcelona attack victims |url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/barcelona/2017/08/21/599b14c746163fb0098b461b.html |accessdate=29 July 2018 |work=Marca |date=21 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Bartlett |first1=Evan |title=Barcelona defender Lucas Digne 'helped terror attack victims with water bottles and homemade tourniquets' |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/barcelona-defender-lucas-dignes-terror-attack-victims-water-bottles-homemade-tourniquets-football-a7906571.html |accessdate=29 July 2018 |work=The Independent |date=22 August 2017}}</ref>
