{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{spanish name|Mina|González}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Yerry Mina | image = FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - Photo 103 (cropped).jpg | image_size = | caption = Mina playing for [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Yerry Fernando Mina González<ref name=FIFA>{{cite web |url=https://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FWC/2018/pdf/FWC_2018_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia: List of players: Colombia |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=5 |date=10 June 2018 |accessdate=11 June 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|9|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Guachené]], Colombia | height = 1.95 m<ref name=FIFA /> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|Centre-back]] | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 13 | youthyears1 = 2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Deportivo Pasto]] | years1 = 2013 | clubs1 = [[Deportivo Pasto]] | caps1 = 14 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2014–2016 | clubs2 = [[Independiente Santa Fe|Santa Fe]] | caps2 = 67 | goals2 = 7 | years3 = 2016–2018 | clubs3 = [[Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|Palmeiras]] | caps3 = 28 | goals3 = 6 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps5 = 12 | goals5 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Colombia Olympic football team|Colombia U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2016– | nationalteam2 = [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] | nationalcaps2 = 16 | nationalgoals2 = 6 | club-update = 17 March 2019 | nationalteam-update = 21:24, 22 March 2019 (UTC) | medaltemplates = {{Medal|Team|{{fb|COL}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Copa América Centenario]]}} {{Medal|B|[[Copa América Centenario|2016 United States]]|}} }} '''Yerry Fernando Mina González''' ({{IPA-es|ˈɟʝeri ˈmina}}; born 23 September 1994) is a Colombian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]] for English club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[Colombia national football team|Colombia national team]]. He shares the record for most goals in a single World Cup by a defender, with three goals at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref name="threegoals">{{Cite web |url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2018-2019/yerry-mina-world-cup-sensation-in-russia |title=Yerry Mina, sensation in Russia |website=www.fcbarcelona.com |language=en-GB|access-date=4 July 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Deportivo Pasto=== Born in [[Guachené]], Mina was a [[Deportivo Pasto]] youth graduate, joining the side only at the age of 18.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://independientesantafe.com/2013/12/yo-siempre-habia-sonado-estar-en-santa-fe-yerry-mina/ |title="Yo siempre había soñado estar en Santa Fe" Yerry Mina|trans-title="I always have dreamt of being at Santa Fe" Yerry Mina |publisher=Independiente Santa Fe |language=es |date=18 December 2013|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> Promoted to the main squad during the 2013 season, he made his senior debut on 20 March of that year by starting in a 0–1 away loss against [[Dépor F.C.|Dépor]] in the year's [[Copa Colombia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://hsbnoticias.com/deportivo-pasto-sigue-tercero-en-copa-colombia-33903 |title=Deportivo Pasto sigue tercero en Copa Colombia|trans-title=Deportivo Pasto remain third in the Copa Colombia |publisher=HSB Noticias |language=es |date=21 March 2013|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref>
Mina made his [[Categoría Primera A]] debut on 15 September 2013, starting in a 0–0 draw at [[Deportivo Cali]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elpais.com.co/deportes/deportivo-cali-no-brillo-en-palmaseca-y-empato-con-el-pasto.html |title=Deportivo Cali no brilló en Palmaseca y empató con el Pasto|trans-title=Deportivo Cali did not shine at the Palmaseca and drew with Pasto |publisher=[[El País (Cali)|El País]] |language=es |date=15 September 2013|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> His first professional goal occurred on 18 October, as he scored his team's first in a 2–2 home draw against [[Atlético Huila]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.minuto30.com/liga-postobon-pasto-aplazo-su-clasificacion-a-cuadrangulares-empato-ante-huila-en-casa/195265/ |title=Liga Postobón: Pasto aplazó su clasificación a cuadrangulares empató ante Huila en casa|trans-title=Liga Postobón: Pasto delayed his qualification to the quadrangular drawing with Huila at home |publisher=Minuto 30 |language=es |date=19 October 2013|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref>
===Independiente Santa Fe=== On 14 December 2013, Mina moved to fellow top tier club [[Independiente Santa Fe]], initially on a one-year loan deal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://independientesantafe.co/2013/12/santa-fe-confirma-nuevo-defensa-central-para-2014/ |title=Santa Fe confirma nuevo defensa central para 2014|trans-title=Santa Fe confirm new central defender for 2014 |publisher=Independiente Santa Fe |language=es |date=14 December 2013|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut for the club the following 25 January, playing the full 90 minutes in a 3–0 home win against [[Rionegro F.C.|Rionegro]].
Mina immediately became a regular starter for the side, winning the [[2015 Superliga Colombiana]] by netting the first goal in the 2–0 win against [[Atlético Nacional]] in the second leg of the Finals.
===Palmeiras=== On 1 May 2016, Mina was confirmed as the new player of [[Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras|Palmeiras]], but only joined the club in the following month.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/futebol/times/palmeiras/noticia/2016/05/palmeiras-acerta-contratacao-do-zagueiro-yerry-mina-do-santa-fe.html |title=Palmeiras acerta contratação do zagueiro Yerry Mina, do Santa Fe|trans-title=Palmeiras sign stopper Yerry Mina, from Santa Fe |publisher=[[Globo Esporte]] |language=pt |date=1 May 2016|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> He signed a five-year contract with the club eleven days later.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.palmeiras.com.br/news/2017/03/07/mina-firma-vinculo-por-cinco-anos-e-se-encanta-com-o-allianz-parque.shtml |title=Mina firma vínculo por cinco anos e se encanta com o Allianz Parque|trans-title=Mina signs five-year link and is delighted with Allianz Parque |publisher=SE Palmeiras |language=pt |date=11 May 2016|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref>
Mina made his debut for the club on 4 July 2016, playing a full game in a 3–1 away defeat of [[Sport Club do Recife|Sport Recife]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://esporte.uol.com.br/futebol/campeonatos/brasileiro/serie-a/ultimas-noticias/2016/07/04/sport-x-palmeiras.htm |title=Com Jesus decisivo, Palmeiras bate Sport e mantém vantagem na liderança|trans-title=With decisive Jesus, Palmeiras defeat Sport and maintain advantage on the leadership |publisher=[[Universo Online|UOL Esporte]] |language=pt |date=4 July 2016|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> His first goal for the ''Verdão'' arrived in the following fixture, a 1–1 draw against [[Santos FC|Santos]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com.br/noticia/613069_palmeiras-sofre-empate-do-santos-e-tropeca-pela-1-vez-em-casa-no-brasileiro |title=Palmeiras sofre empate do Santos e tropeça pela 1ª vez em casa no Brasileiro|trans-title=Palmeiras suffer draw with Santos and slip for the first time at home in the Brasileiro |publisher=[[ESPN Brasil]] |language=pt |date=12 July 2016|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref> He was, however, rotated off just before the end of the first half due to an apparent injury. He was carried off the field on a stretcher, in tears. On 13 July it was confirmed that Mina would not recover in time for the [[2016 Summer Olympics]], with the recuperation from his injury expected to take 6 to 8 weeks.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lance.com.br/palmeiras/com-lesao-mina-fica-fora-por-ate-dois-meses-vai-perder-olimpiada.html |title=Com lesão, Mina fica fora por até dois meses e vai perder a Olimpíada|trans-title=With injury, Mina stays out for until two months and will miss the Olympics |publisher=[[Lance!]] |language=pt |date=13 July 2016|access-date=14 January 2018}}</ref>
By late August 2016, Mina had fully recovered from his injury, and was an undisputed starter during the latter stages of [[2016 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A|the season]]. In September, he scored goals against rivals [[São Paulo FC|São Paulo]] and [[Sport Club Corinthians Paulista|Corinthians]], and finished the year with four league goals as his team was awarded the trophy for the first time in 22 years.
===Barcelona=== On 11 January 2018, [[FC Barcelona]] and Palmeiras reached an agreement regarding the transfer of Yerry Mina for the remainder of the current season and five more seasons, until 30 June 2023. This made him the first-ever Colombian to play for the club. The cost of the transfer was €11.8 million, and his release clause was set at €100 million. <ref>Barcelona.com on 8 February 2018,Yerry Mina made his debut for Barcelona as a substitute in the 82nd minute in a 2–0 win over Valencia Cf in the copa del rey.</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2017-2018/agreement-for-the-transfer-of-yerry-mina-palmeiras-fc-barcelona |title=Agreement for the transfer of Yerry Mina {{!}} FC Barcelona|website=FC Barcelona|language=en-US|access-date=11 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Barcelona Profile |url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/staff/players/2017-2018/yerry-mina}}</ref>
Mina made his debut replacing [[Gerard Piqué]] in the 83rd minute of the Copa del Rey semi-final against [[Valencia CF|Valencia]]. Barcelona would go on to win the match 2–0 and advance to the [[2018 Copa del Rey Final|final]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/barcelona/2018/02/09/5a7cd77ee5fdea33778b457d.html |title=Copa del Rey – Valencia 0–2 Barcelona: Yerry Mina makes his Barcelona debut – MARCA in English |publisher=}}</ref> He would make his home and league debut against [[Getafe CF|Getafe]], starting and playing the full game to a 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/barcelona-player-ratings-yerry-minas-12008685 |title=Barcelona player ratings from draw with Getafe |first=Rik |last=Sharma |date=11 February 2018 |publisher=}}</ref> He made his first official contribution at the club as he assisted [[Ousmane Dembélé]] in a 5–1 defeat of [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/match?gameId=490378 |title=Barcelona vs. Villarreal – Football Match Summary – May 9, 2018 – ESPN |website=ESPN.com|access-date=7 June 2018}}</ref>
===Everton=== On 8 August 2018, Mina signed with [[Premier League]] team [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in a deal worth €30 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-my/amp/news/barcelona-confirm-30m-yerry-mina-deal-with-everton/kf7stilf0mqp1979u8wy04wm9 |title=Mina completes €30M Everton move as Barcelona team-mate Gomes joins on loan |work=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|access-date= 8 August 2018 |date=8 August 2018}}</ref>
His first appearance came during a 3–1 home victory against [[Brighton and Hove Albion]], as a last-minute substitute for Gylfi Sigurdsson.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46000539 |title=Mina makes debut late on against Brighton |publisher= BBC Sport |access-date= 3 November 2018 |date=3 November 2018}}</ref>
He scored his first goal for Everton in a 5–1 away win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], a header during the opening 2 minutes of the match following a great cross from [[Bernard Duarte|Bernard]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46615195 |title=Mina's first Everton goal |publisher= BBC Sport |access-date= 26 December 2018 |date=26 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:FWC 2018 - Round of 16 - COL v ENG - Photo 048.jpg|thumb|left|Mina ties a match against England in Round of 16 at the 2018 FIFA World Cup]] In 2016, Mina was named to Colombia's [[Copa América Centenario]] squad, starting one game against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]]. He played in five of Colombia's [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 World Cup Qualifying]] matches from October 2016 to March 2017,<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/196901/yerry-mina?season=2015 |title=Yerry Mina: Appearances |publisher=ESPNFC}}</ref> and in May 2018 he was named to Colombia’s final 23-man [[Colombia national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb |title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref>
At the [[2018 World Cup]], Mina scored three goals for Colombia, all headers off of corner kicks. Mina did not play in Colombia's opening 2–1 loss with [[Japan national football team|Japan]],<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331550/#match-liveblog |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - Colombia - Japan - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2018/jun/19/colombia-v-japan-world-cup-2018-live-updates |title=Colombia 1–2 Japan: World Cup 2018 – as it happened |last=Murray |first=Scott |date=19 June 2018 |work=The Guardian|access-date=28 June 2018 |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077}}</ref> but started at [[centre back]] in each of Colombia's remaining matches. In the group stage, he scored the opening goal in a 3–0 win over [[Poland national football team|Poland]],<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331508/#match-liveblog |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - Poland - Colombia - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5880293/Poland-0-3-Colombia-Robert-Lewandowskis-Poland-World-Cup.html |title=Poland 0–3 Colombia: Robert Lewandowski's Poland out of the World Cup |work=Mail Online|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref> then scored the lone goal in a 1–0 win over [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] which propelled Colombia to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup Group H|top of their group]] and into the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|knockout stage]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44439305 |title=World Cup 2018: Senegal 0–1 Colombia |date=28 June 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=28 June 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331553/#match-summary |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - Senegal - Colombia - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=28 June 2018}}</ref> Against [[England national football team|England]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|round of sixteen]], Mina tied the scoring 1–1 in the 93rd minute to send the game into extra time. Colombia went on to lose the game on penalty kicks, ending their tournament.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331542/#match-summary |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - Colombia - England - FIFA.com |last=FIFA.com |website=www.fifa.com |language=en-GB|access-date=3 July 2018}}</ref> With his three goals, he tied the record number of goals scored by a defender in a single World Cup tournament, sharing the record with Germans [[Paul Breitner]] in 1974 and [[Andreas Brehme]] in 1990.<ref name="threegoals" />
==Personal life== Yerry Mina's father and uncle were both professional football goalkeepers. His father advised him to play another position, and his uncle took him to [[Deportivo Pasto]]'s trial.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.tifofootball.com/features/yerry-minas-journey-colombia-barcelona-via-brazil/ |title=Yerry Mina's journey from Colombia to Barcelona, via Brazil – Tifo Football |work=Tifo Football |access-date=10 January 2018 |language=en-US |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180110174312/https://www.tifofootball.com/features/yerry-minas-journey-colombia-barcelona-via-brazil/ |archive-date=10 January 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
His uncle, Jair Mina, is also his agent.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2749039-yerry-minas-agent-reveals-no-contact-from-barcelona-amid-january-rumours |title=Yerry Mina's Agent Reveals No Contact from Barcelona Amid January Rumours |last=Jones |first=Matt |work=Bleacher Report|access-date=10 January 2018 |language=en-US}}</ref>
Mina is a devout [[Christianity|Christian]] and is a member of the neo-Pentecostal [[Church of God Ministry of Jesus Christ International]]. Mina has spoken publicly at many events sponsored by the church to talk about his life and faith.<ref>{{cite web|title=Yerry Mina, el defensa goleador que hizo gritar a Colombia|url=https://www.vanguardia.com/deportes/mundial-de-futbol/yerry-mina-el-defensa-goleador-que-hizo-gritar-a-colombia-JEVL438274|date=8 July 2018|accessdate=9 February 2019|language=Spanish|publisher=[[Vanguardia Liberal]]}}</ref>

Tosun<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|6|7|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Wetzlar]], Germany | height = 1.83 m | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 1997–2009 | youthclubs1 = [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] | years1 = 2008–2010 | clubs1 = [[Eintracht Frankfurt|Eintracht Frankfurt II]] | caps1 = 17 | goals1 = 12 | years2 = 2009–2011 | clubs2 = [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] | caps2= 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2011–2014 | clubs3 = [[Gaziantepspor]] | caps3 = 109 | goals3 = 39 | years4 = 2014–2018 | clubs4 = [[Beşiktaş J.K|Beşiktaş]] | caps4 = 96 | goals4 = 41 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps5 = 34 | goals5 = 7 | nationalyears1 = 2006–2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Germany national under-16 football team|Germany U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam2 = [[Germany national under-18 football team|Germany U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 6 | nationalyears3 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam3 = [[Germany national under-19 football team|Germany U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 8 | nationalgoals3 = 6 | nationalyears4 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam4 = [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2012 | nationalteam5 = [[Turkey national under-21 football team|Turkey U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 1 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2011–2015 | nationalteam6 = [[Turkey A2 national football team|Turkey A2]] | nationalcaps6 = 12 | nationalgoals6 = 7 | nationalyears7 = 2013– | nationalteam7 = [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] | nationalcaps7 = 35 | nationalgoals7 = 11 | club-update = 13:32, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:34, 24 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Cenk Tosun''' ({{IPA-tr|dʒæɲc ˈtosun|lang}}; born 7 June 1991) is a Turkish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[Turkey national football team|Turkey national team]].
After making one [[Bundesliga]] appearance for [[Eintracht Frankfurt]], he transferred to [[Gaziantepspor]] in January 2011, where he won the [[Spor Toto Cup]] in 2012. In 2014, he was signed by [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] and won two [[Süper Lig]] titles before transferring to Everton in January 2018 for a reported £27 million transfer fee.
Tosun was born in Germany and represented the country from [[Germany national under-16 football team|under-16]] to [[Germany national under-21 football team|under-21]] level. He then changed his allegiance to Turkey, for whom he made his senior international debut with in 2013, and played at [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Eintracht Frankfurt=== Born in [[Wetzlar]] in the German state of [[Hesse]], Tosun began his career with [[Eintracht Frankfurt]]. He played mainly for the [[Eintracht Frankfurt II|reserves]] in the [[Regionalliga]]. His sole first team appearance was on 8 May 2010 in the final match of the [[2009–10 Bundesliga]] season as a 75th-minute substitute for [[Martin Fenin]] in a 3–1 loss at [[VfL Wolfsburg]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dzeko schießt sich zur Torjäger-Kanone|trans-title=Dzeko shoots the ''Torjäger'' Cannon|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2009-10/34/938335/spielanalyse_vfl-wolfsburg-24_eintracht-frankfurt-32.html|accessdate=28 December 2017|work=kicker|date=8 May 2010|language=German}}</ref>
===Gaziantepspor=== On 29 January 2011, Tosun joined [[Gaziantepspor]] for a €400,000 transfer fee.<ref name=echo/> He scored 10 goals in 14 league matches in his debut season. After a less successful second season, he scored double digits in the following two campaigns and helped the club win the [[Spor Toto Cup]] in 2012.<ref name=echo/> He scored twice in the final, a 3–1 win over [[Orduspor]] on 17 May 2012.<ref name=toto>{{cite news|title=Antep'in kupa keyfi!|trans-title=Antep's trophy pressure|url=http://tr.beinsports.com/haber/antepin-kupa-keyfi|accessdate=11 March 2018|publisher=beIN Sports|date=18 May 2012|language=Turkish}}</ref>
===Beşiktaş=== On 4 February 2014, [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]] signed Tosun on a five-year contract worth nearly €500,000, effective from the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sabah.com.tr/spor/futbol/2014/02/04/besiktas-cenk-tosunu-acikladi|title=Cenk Tosun resmen Beşiktaş'ta|date=4 February 2014|accessdate=10 November 2014|language=tr}}</ref> He chose the number 23 shirt after basketball player [[Michael Jordan]].<ref name=echo/> In his first two campaigns at the [[Istanbul]] club, he was mainly a substitute, behind [[Demba Ba]] and [[Mario Gómez]] in the pecking order.<ref name=echo/> After Ba and Gómez left, he was a regular in the [[2016–17 Beşiktaş J.K. season|2016–17 season]], scoring 24 goals as his club won the [[2016–17 Süper Lig|Süper Lig title]].<ref name=echo/> He then turned down a move to [[Premier League]] club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref name=echo/>
In [[2017–18 Beşiktaş J.K. season|2017–18]], Tosun scored four goals in six match as Beşiktaş won a [[UEFA Champions League]] [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage|group]] containing [[RB Leipzig]], [[FC Porto|Porto]] and [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], including both of a 2–1 win at Monaco on 17 October.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tosun brace sees Besiktas beat Monaco|url=https://www.sport24.co.za/Soccer/ChampionsLeague/tosun-brace-sees-besiktas-beat-monaco-20171018|accessdate=28 December 2017|publisher=Sport 24|date=18 October 2017}}</ref>
===Everton=== On 5 January 2018, Tosun joined Premier League club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] for a reported £27 million transfer fee, signing a four-and-a-half-year contract with the Merseyside club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cenk Tosun: Everton agree deal for £27m Besiktas striker|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42567472|accessdate=5 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Blues Sign Striker Tosun|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/01/05/blues-sign-striker-tosun|accessdate=5 January 2018|publisher=Everton Football Club|date=5 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut eight days later, playing 61 minutes of a 4–0 loss away to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news|title="The Turkish Duncan Ferguson" – Reaction to Cenk Tosun's Everton debut in game away to Tottenham|url=https://talksport.com/football/turkish-duncan-ferguson-reaction-cenk-tosuns-everton-debut-game-away-tottenham-180113268424|accessdate=14 January 2018|publisher=Talksport|date=13 January 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 2–1 away loss against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on 3 March.<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley 2–1 Everton: Cenk Tosun finally scores but Clarets win after late comeback|url=https://talksport.com/football/burnley-2-1-everton-cenk-tosun-finally-scores-clarets-win-after-late-comeback-180303274203|accessdate=10 March 2018|publisher=Talksport|date=3 March 2018}}</ref> Manager [[Sam Allardyce]] praised Tosun when he received criticism for the start of his Everton career.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bascombe|first1=Chris|title=Cenk Tosun is not an Everton transfer flop, insists Sam Allardyce|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/03/09/cenk-tosun-not-everton-transfer-flop-insists-sam-allardyce/|accessdate=10 March 2018|work=The Daily Telegraph|date=9 March 2018}}</ref> Tosun and fellow new signing [[Theo Walcott]] helped an Everton side that had struggled for goals in the first half of the season as the club finished in eighth place in the [[2017–18 Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gorst |first1=Paul |title=Sam Allardyce's true Everton legacy will be the signings of Cenk Tosun and Theo Walcott |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sam-allardyces-true-everton-legacy-14662589 |accessdate=5 June 2018 |work=Liverpool Echo |date=16 May 2018}}</ref>
==International career== ===Germany youth=== Tosun played for [[Germany national under-19 football team|Germany under-19]] in qualification for the [[2010 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]. In the qualifying group in Luxembourg, he scored twice in a 5–0 win over [[Moldova national under-19 football team|Moldova]] and a consolation goal in a 2–1 loss to [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Türkei und Deutschland in der Eliterunde |trans-title=Turkey and Germany in the Elite Round|url=http://de.uefa.com/under19/news/newsid=903100.html |accessdate=5 June 2018 |publisher=UEFA |date=12 October 2009 |language=German}}</ref> He scored a hat-trick in a 4–1 win over [[Poland national under-19 football team|Poland]] in the Elite Round, but Germany did not advance to the finals in France.<ref>{{cite news |title=Dreierpack von Tosun|trans-title=Tosun's hat-trick|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/junioren/startseite/525289/artikel_Dreierpack-von-Tosun.html |accessdate=5 June 2018 |work=kicker |date=18 May 2010 |language=German}}</ref>
On 16 November 2010, Tosun made his [[Germany national under-21 football team|under-21]] debut in a 2–0 friendly win over [[England national under-21 football team|England]] in [[Wiesbaden]], scoring a penalty for the second goal.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Frank |title=England Under-21s call on Arsenal's Henri Lansbury in goal during 2–0 defeat to Germany |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/8670915.Lansbury_and_Loach_in_goal_for_England/ |accessdate=5 June 2018 |work=Watford Observer |date=17 November 2010}}</ref>
===Turkey=== [[File:Cenk Tosun.jpg|thumb|upright|Tosun with [[Turkey A2 national football team|Turkey A2]] in June 2013]] Tosun made his senior international debut for [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] on 15 October 2013, replacing [[Selçuk İnan]] for the final 16 minutes of a 2–0 loss to the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifying match]] at the [[Şükrü Saracoğlu Stadium]] in Istanbul; the result ended the Turks' hope of qualification.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tozar|first1=Türker|title=Dutch double ends Turkey hopes|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008632/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=28 December 2017|publisher=UEFA|date=15 October 2013}}</ref> On 13 November 2015, he scored his first international goal, the winner in a 2–1 friendly triumph away to [[Qatar national football team|Qatar]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Turan and Tosun are top tormentors as Turkey triumph|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-friendly-qatar/turan-and-tosun-are-top-tormentors-as-turkey-triumph-idUKKCN0T22AU20151113|accessdate=28 December 2017|publisher=Reuters|date=13 November 2015}}</ref> He added another two goals on 24 March 2016 in a 2–1 friendly win over [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] in [[Antalya]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Tosun double gives Turkey morale-boosting win over Sweden|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-friendly-tur-swe/tosun-double-gives-turkey-morale-boosting-win-over-sweden-idUKKCN0WQ2F4|accessdate=11 March 2018|publisher=Reuters|date=24 March 2016}}</ref>
Tosun was part of the 23-man squad chosen by head coach [[Fatih Terim]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] in France.<ref>{{cite news|title=Barcelona's Arda Turan leads Turkey Euro 2016 squad|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/turkey/story/2883807/barcelonas-arda-turan-leads-turkey-euro-2016-squad|accessdate=28 December 2017|publisher=ESPN|date=31 May 2016}}</ref> He started in the opening match, a 1–0 loss to [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], but was dropped in favour of [[Burak Yılmaz]] for the following match against [[Spain national football team|Spain]]. Tosun then returned as an added-time substitute in the 2–0 win over the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] in [[Lens, Pas-de-Calais|Lens]] that was not enough to take Turkey to the round of 16.<ref>{{cite news|title=Turkey overpower Czechs to go third|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000448/match=2017900/index.html|accessdate=28 December 2017|publisher=UEFA|date=21 June 2016}}</ref>
In Turkey's [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group I|failed qualification campaign]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]], Tosun scored five goals. These were braces in both matches against [[Finland national football team|Finland]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Tosun double boosts Turkey World Cup hopes|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-worldcup-turkey-finland/tosun-double-boosts-turkey-world-cup-hopes-idUSKBN16V2LV|accessdate=11 March 2018|publisher=Reuters|date=24 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Out of contention, Turkey's World Cup journey to end in Finland|url=https://www.dailysabah.com/football/2017/10/09/out-of-contention-turkeys-world-cup-journey-to-end-in-finland|accessdate=11 March 2018|work=Daily Sabah|date=9 October 2017}}</ref> and the only goal of a home win over eventual qualifiers Croatia on 5 September 2017.<ref>{{cite news|title=Turkey beats Croatia 1–0 to open up qualifying Group I|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/90minutes/ct-hoy-turkey-beats-croatia-1-0-to-open-up-qualifying-group-i-20170905-story.html|accessdate=11 March 2018|work=Chicago Tribune|agency=Associated Press|date=5 September 2017}}</ref> On 1 June 2018, Tosun scored a penalty to open a 2–2 friendly draw with [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]] in [[Geneva]], then was sent-off for the first time in his career for a confrontation with the Turkish fans; he said he intervened because he thought his father was being attacked in the crowd.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Jones |first1=Adam |title=Turkey manager stands up for Everton's Cenk Tosun following bizarre red card incident |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/turkey-manager-stands-up-evertons-14744650 |accessdate=5 June 2018 |work=Liverpool Echo |date=5 June 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Tosun has said his ability is equal with his left and right foot, as his father Senol forbade him from using his right foot in an attempt to strengthen his left.<ref name=echo>{{cite news|last1=Jones|first1=Neil|title=Everton target Cenk Tosun – the two-footed Turk who idolises Gabriel Omar Batistuta and just loves scoring goals|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-target-cenk-tosun-two-14087702|accessdate=28 December 2017|work=Liverpool Echo|date=28 December 2017}}</ref> As a boy, he idolised Argentine forward [[Gabriel Batistuta]].<ref name=echo/> While Tosun likens himself to [[Mario Gómez]] and [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]], ''[[The Times]]'' writer Gary Jacob instead found him more similar to the English strikers [[Kevin Davies]] and [[Andy Carroll]] for his physicality.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tosun cuts frustrated figure on Everton debut|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/tosun-cuts-frustrated-figure-on-everton-debut-59cl23rq7|accessdate=14 January 2018|work=The Times|date=13 January 2018}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{Updated|match played 9 February 2019|<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.mackolik.com/Futbolcu/44369/Cenk-Tosun | title = Cenk Tosun > Club Matches | publisher = mackolik.com}}</ref>}}

revision.text:
'''James McCarthy''' may refer to:
* [[James McCarthy (bishop)]] (1853–1943), Bishop of Galloway * [[James McCarthy (footballer)]] (born 1990), Ireland international footballer * [[James McCarthy (Gaelic footballer)]] (born 1990), player for Dublin and Ballymun Kickhams * [[James McCarthy (sociologist)]] (born 1949), president of Suffolk University in Boston, Massachusetts * [[James McCarthy (surveyor)]] (1853–1919), Irish surveyor who mapped the boundaries of Siam in the 19th century * [[James McCarthy (oceanographer)]], Harvard professor of biological oceanography * [[James F. McCarthy]], college football coach * [[James Francis McCarthy]] (born 1942), American Roman Catholic bishop * [[James P. McCarthy]] (born 1935), U.S. Air Force general * [[James William McCarthy]] (1872–1939), U.S. federal judge * [[James Joseph McCarthy]] (1817–1882), Irish architect * [[Babe McCarthy]] (James H. McCarthy, 1923–1975), American basketball coach * Sir James McCarthy (died 1824), governor of [[Cape Coast Castle]] * James McCarthy, villain of the Sherlock Holmes story ''[[The Boscombe Valley Mystery]]''
==See also== * [[Jim McCarthy (disambiguation)]]

{{EngvarB|date=January 2019}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2019}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Morgan Schneiderlin | image = Cskamu 50.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Schneiderlin with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2015 | fullname = Morgan Fernand Gérard Schneiderlin{{cite web |url=http://entreprises.lefigaro.fr/mc-immo-67/entreprise-833743420 |title=Entreprise MC Immo à Zellwiller (67140) |trans-title=Company MC Immo in Zellwiller (67140) |website=Figaro Entreprises |publisher=Société du Figaro |accessdate=26 January 2019 |language=French}}
{{cite web |url=https://dirigeants.bfmtv.com/Morgan-SCHNEIDERLIN-5152291/ |title=Morgan Schneiderlin |website=BFM Business |accessdate=26 January 2019 |language=French}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|11|8|df=y}}{{cite web |url=https://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf |title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: List of Players: France |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=15 |date=14 July 2014 |accessdate=22 January 2019}} | birth_place = [[Obernai]], France | height = 1.81 m{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/4615/Morgan-Schneiderlin/overview |title=Morgan Schneiderlin: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=22 January 2019}} | position = [[Defensive midfielder]]{{cite news |first=Richard |last=Innes |title=Manchester United new boy Morgan Schneiderlin is top of the Premier League's defensive stats |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/manchester-united-new-boy-morgan-6064524 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=14 July 2015 |accessdate=4 August 2015}} | currentclub = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 1995–2005 |youthclubs1 = [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg]] | years1 = 2005–2008 |clubs1 = [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg B]] |caps1 = 37 |goals1 = 5 | years2 = 2006–2008 |clubs2 = [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg]] |caps2 = 5 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2008–2015 |clubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |caps3 = 231 |goals3 = 14 | years4 = 2015–2017 |clubs4 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps4 = 32 |goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2017– |clubs5 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps5 = 52 |goals5 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2004–2005 |nationalteam1 = [[France national under-16 football team|France U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 6 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2005–2006 |nationalteam2 = [[France national under-17 football team|France U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 5 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2006–2007 |nationalteam3 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] |nationalcaps3 = 2 |nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2007–2008 |nationalteam4 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] |nationalcaps4 = 6 |nationalgoals4 = 2 | nationalyears5 = 2009–2010 |nationalteam5 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] |nationalcaps5 = 9 |nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2010 |nationalteam6 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] |nationalcaps6 = 3 |nationalgoals6 = 1 | nationalyears7 = 2014– |nationalteam7 = [[France national football team|France]] |nationalcaps7 = 15 |nationalgoals7 = 0 | medaltemplates = {{medalCountry|[[French national football team|France]]}} {{medalSilver|[[UEFA European Championship|European Championship]]|[[UEFA Euro 2016|2016]]}} | club-update = 13:49, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 03:27, 22 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Morgan Fernand Gérard Schneiderlin''' ({{IPA-fr|mɔʁgan ʃnedɛʁlɛ̃}};{{cite news |url=https://forvo.com/word/morgan_schneiderlin/ |title=How to pronounce Morgan Schneiderlin |website=Forvo |accessdate=22 January 2019}} born 8 November 1989) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[defensive midfielder]] for English {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[France national football team|France national team]]. Schneiderlin began his career with [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg]], before moving to England to join [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in June 2008. He made 260 appearances across all competitions in seven seasons at the club, and was in the teams which earned consecutive promotions to reach the Premier League. He joined [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] for a potential £27 million fee in July 2015, but left for Everton in January 2017 for a fee of up to £24 million. After representing France at all levels from [[France national under-16 football team|under-16]] onwards, Schneiderlin made his senior international debut in 2014. He was included in their squads for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. ==Club career== ===Strasbourg=== Born in [[Obernai]], Alsace,{{Hugman|25256|accessdate=22 January 2019}} Schneiderlin started playing football with his friends at the SR Zellwiller football ground,{{cite web |url=http://o-posts.com/news/teams/uk/morgan-schneiderlin-southamptons-tenacious-bull-terrier/ |title=Morgan Schneiderlin: Southampton's Tenacious Bull-Terrier |first=Adam |last=Gray |website=O-Posts |date=22 March 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150721230538/http://o-posts.com/news/teams/uk/morgan-schneiderlin-southamptons-tenacious-bull-terrier/ |archivedate=21 July 2015}} but began his career later with the major regional club [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg]]'s youth ranks in 1995, after members of his family brought him to one of the club's scouting sessions when he was five years old. After 10 years moving through the youth ranks, he signed his first professional contract with the club in 2005 and debuted for the B-team later that year. In 2006, he made his professional debut with the senior side and would go on to make four more appearances for the club, before being sold following the club's relegation during the [[2007–08 Ligue 1]] season.{{cite web |url=http://www.sofoot.com/morgan-schneiderlin-le-ballon-d-alsace-185454.html |title=Morgan Schneiderlin, le ballon d'Alsace |trans-title=Morgan Schneiderlin, the Alsace Balloon |first=Régis |last=Delanoë |website=SO FOOT.com |date=20 June 2014 |accessdate=22 January 2019 |language=French}}{{cite news |url=https://www.dna.fr/actualite/2014/06/06/morgan-schneiderlin-rappele |title=Morgan Schneiderlin rappelé! |trans-title=Morgan Schneiderlin recalled! |newspaper=Les Dernières Nouvelles d'Alsace |location=Strasbourg |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=22 January 2019 |language=French}}{{cite web |url=https://www.francebleu.fr/sports/football/football-retour-aux-sources-pour-l-international-alsacien-morgan-schneiderlin-1435084855 |title=Retour aux sources pour l'international alsacien Morgan Schneiderlin |trans-title=Back to the roots for Alsatian international Morgan Schneiderlin |first=Céline |last=Rousseau |publisher=France Bleu |date=23 June 2015 |accessdate=22 January 2019 |language=French}} ===Southampton=== Schneiderlin moved from Strasbourg to [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 27 June 2008, having signed a four-year contract in a deal that could rise to €1.5 million (£1.2 million).{{cite news |date=27 June 2008 |title=Saints tie up Schneiderlin deal |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/southampton/7477504.stm |accessdate=27 June 2008}} He joined Southampton despite receiving an offer from [[South Coast derby|local rivals]] [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]], then a [[Premier League]] team. Schneiderlin made his debut in a 2–1 defeat away to [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 9 August 2008.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/s/southampton/7540944.stm |title=Cardiff 2–1 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2008 |accessdate=14 August 2013}} [[File:Morgan Schneiderlin 2.jpg|thumb|upright|Schneiderlin playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2014]] The Frenchman scored his first goal for Southampton away against [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] on 13 April 2010, with the match finishing in a 5–1 victory.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8605978.stm |title=Bristol Rovers 1–5 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 April 2010 |accessdate=13 April 2010}} Schneiderlin signed a new deal with Saints on 19 August 2011, to keep him at the club until the summer of 2014. On 24 September, he came off the bench to score his second goal for the club in a 1–1 draw at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]]. He scored a 35-yard effort in a 3–0 victory at [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], meaning he had scored more than one goal in a season for the first time at Southampton.{{citation needed|date=September 2014}} After promotion to the Premier League, he kept his place in the side, playing the full 90 minutes of the opening game against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. On 2 September 2012, he scored a goal against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], giving his side a 2–1 lead but the club eventually fell 3–2 as [[Robin van Persie]] netted a hat-trick.{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/267520/report |title=RVP hat-trick sinks Saints |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 September 2012 |accessdate=14 August 2013}} Schneiderlin followed this up with another home goal in a 1–1 draw with [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 10 November, trapping a [[Rickie Lambert]] header with his chest and then placing the ball past onrushing goalkeeper [[Gerhard Tremmel]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20189996 |title=Southampton 1–1 Swansea |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2012 |accessdate=14 August 2013}} On 16 January 2013, he captained Southampton in a comeback which saw them draw 2–2 with European champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/16/chelsea-southampton-premier-league?CMP=twt_gu |title=Southampton's Lambert and Puncheon knock Chelsea out of their stride |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=16 January 2013 |accessdate=14 August 2013}} He went on to score his third Premier League goal in a 2–2 draw with [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 2 February, helping Southampton fight back from a goal down.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21209221 |title=S Wigan 2–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 February 2013 |accessdate=14 August 2013}} On 25 February 2013, Schneiderlin signed a new contract extension to keep him at Southampton until the summer of 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/schneiderlin-signs-until-2017-678957.aspx |title=Schneiderlin Signs Until 2017 |publisher=Southampton F.C |date=25 February 2013 |accessdate=25 February 2013}} At the end of the season, Schneiderlin was credited for the most tackles, interceptions and highest work rate in the Premier League, establishing himself as one of the best [[defensive midfielder]]s in England.{{cite web |title=Stats Zone Premier League Central Midfielder of the Year |url=http://fourfourtwo.com/blogs/statszone/archive/2013/05/31/stats-zone-premier-league-central-midfielder-of-the-year.aspx |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |accessdate=15 June 2013 |date=31 May 2013}} He picked up both the Players' Player and Fans' Player of the Year awards at Southampton's end of season awards.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/morgan-does-the-double-821815.aspx |title=Morgan Does the Double! |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=14 May 2013 |accessdate=14 May 2013}} Schneiderlin scored twice in a 3–1 win at [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 30 August 2014, equalling his goal tally from the previous season's Premier League campaign.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28906779 |title=West Ham 1–3 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2014 |accessdate=30 August 2014}} He scored his third goal of the season against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 13 September, curling in a late strike past goalkeeper [[Tim Krul]], as the Saints won 4–0.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29090536 |title=Southampton 4–0 Newcastle |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 September 2014 |accessdate=28 September 2014}} On 28 December, he was sent off two minutes from the end of a 1–1 home draw against Chelsea.{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=Southampton 1–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30566736 |accessdate=28 December 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 December 2014}} He suffered a knee injury against Tottenham on 25 April 2015, ruling him out for the remainder of the season.{{cite news |title=Morgan Schneiderlin: Southampton midfielder out for season |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32532932 |accessdate=30 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 April 2015}} ===Manchester United=== [[File:Young, Schneiderlin - July 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Schneiderlin (right) playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2015]] After much speculation during the summer, Schneiderlin signed for Manchester United on 13 July 2015 for a fee in the region of £25 million.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/33511027 |title=Bastian Schweinsteiger and Morgan Schneiderlin join Man Utd |date=13 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=18 April 2017}} Upon signing for United, he said: "I am delighted to be a Manchester United player. Once I learned that United were interested in signing me, it was a very easy decision to make. I have enjoyed seven very happy years with Southampton and it’s a club that will always be in my heart. But the chance to be part of this squad to help this great club be successful was too good to miss."{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Jul/Manchester-United-sign-France-midfielder-Morgan-Schneiderlin.aspx |title=Manchester United sign Morgan Schneiderlin |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=13 July 2015 |accessdate=18 April 2017}} On 17 July 2015, he made his debut four days after signing, scoring the only goal – a header – as United beat [[Club América]] at [[CenturyLink Field]] in Seattle on their pre-season tour.{{cite web |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2015/Jul/Manchester-United-vs-Club-America-match-report-17-july-2015.aspx |title=United 1 Club America 0 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=17 July 2015 |accessdate=18 July 2015}} He made his Premier League debut on 8 August as the season opened with a 1–0 victory against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Old Trafford]], being chosen by [[BBC Sport]] as the best of United's five debutants that day.{{cite news |last1=Magowan |first1=Alistair |title=Manchester United 1–0 Tottenham Hotspur |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744640 |accessdate=8 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2015}} He scored what would be his only competitive goal for the club on 17 October, opening the scoring in a 3–0 Premier League win away to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]].{{cite news |first=Shamoon |last=Hafez |title=Everton 0–3 Manchester United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34493717 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2015 |accessdate=18 October 2015}} On 21 May, Schneiderlin was an unused substitute in the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] as United beat [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] 2–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36292265 |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Manchester United |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=22 January 2019}} He ended his first season with 38 appearances in all competitions, scoring once.{{cite web |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Features/2015/Sep/appearances-and-goals-for-manchester-united-squad-2015-16.aspx |title=Manchester United squad appearances and goals 2015/16 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=18 April 2017}}{{cite web |first=Mark |last=Froggatt |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2016/May/match-report-crystal-palace-v-manchester-united-fa-cup-final-21-may-2016.aspx |title=Crystal Palace 1 Manchester United 2 |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=21 May 2016 |accessdate=18 April 2017}} Schneiderlin was in the United squad that faced [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in the [[2016 FA Community Shield]] at Wembley Stadium on 7 August, winning 2–1.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36934956 |title=Leicester City 1–2 Manchester United |first=Chris |last=Bevan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2016 |accessdate=22 January 2019}} United won 2–1 with goals from Jesse Lingard and new United teammate [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]]. Due to competition in midfield, he then played less frequently, with a total playing time of 147 minutes in three starts and five substitute appearances during the 2016–17 season.{{cite web |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |title=Schneiderlin completes move to Everton |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Jan/midfielder-morgan-schneiderlin-completes-move-to-everton-from-manchester-united.aspx |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=12 January 2017 |accessdate=23 May 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.whoscored.com/Players/29544/Show/Morgan-Schneiderlinx |title=Morgan Schneiderlin's Profile |website=WhoScored.com |accessdate=23 May 2017}} He was later sold to Everton in the January transfer window due to a lack of playing time.{{cite web |first=Gemma |last=Thompson |url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/Jan/midfielder-morgan-schneiderlin-completes-move-to-everton-from-manchester-united.aspx |title=Morgan Schneiderlin leaves United for Everton |publisher=Manchester United F.C. |date=12 January 2017 |accessdate=18 April 2017}} ===Everton=== [[File:Manchester United v Everton, 17 September 2017 (21).jpg|thumb|upright|Schneiderlin (second from right) with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2017]] On 12 January 2017, Schneiderlin signed a four-and-a-half-year contract with Everton, re-uniting with his former manager [[Ronald Koeman]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38586043 |title=Morgan Schneiderlin: Everton sign Man Utd midfielder for fee rising to £24m |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 January 2017 |accessdate=12 January 2017}} The transfer fee was reported as £20 million, rising to £24 million. Schneiderlin made his debut for Everton three days later as a 65th-minute substitute for [[Kevin Mirallas]] against Manchester City in a 4–0 win at Goodison Park.{{cite news |first=Luke |last=Reddy |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38545988 |title=Match Report Everton 4 Manchester City 0 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 January 2017 |accessdate=11 March 2017}} He scored his first goal in a 3–0 home victory over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 11 March.{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39163818 |title=Everton 3 West Bromwich Albion 0 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 March 2017 |accessdate=11 March 2017}} Schneiderlin's transfer to Everton represented a real turnaround of fortunes for the player, becoming a starter in the defensive midfield role at the club.{{cite news |first=Kristian |last=Walsh |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/morgan-schneiderlin-full-joy-everton-13168964 |title=Morgan Schneiderlin full of joy at Everton – and he wants a top four finish |date=11 June 2017 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |accessdate=1 July 2017}} Schneiderlin was sent off on 2 November 2017 as Everton lost 3–0 at [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], eliminating them from the [[UEFA Europa League]] group stage with two games to spare.{{cite news |last1=Doyle |first1=Ian |title=Everton's Morgan Schneiderlin 'borderline disgraceful and unprofessional' after Europa League red card |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/evertons-morgan-schneiderlin-borderline-disgraceful-13851498 |accessdate=3 November 2017 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=2 November 2017}} In January 2018, West Ham wanted to sign him on loan.{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |last2=Stone |first2=Simon |title=Morgan Schneiderlin: West Ham want to sign Everton midfielder on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42863135 |accessdate=29 July 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 January 2018}} Schneiderlin struggled in the 2017–18 season under managers Ronald Koeman and [[Sam Allardyce]], but was told by new boss [[Marco Silva]] in June 2018 that he had a future at Goodison Park.{{cite news |last1=Bascombe |first1=Chris |title=Everton manager Marco Silva keen to give Morgan Schneiderlin fresh start in Goodison Park shake-up |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/06/13/everton-manager-marco-silva-keen-givemorgan-schneiderlin-fresh/ |accessdate=29 July 2018 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=13 June 2018}} ==International career== ===Youth=== Schneiderlin represented France at under-16, under-17, under-18 whom he [[Captain (association football)|captained]], and under-19 levels.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}} In March 2006, he was selected by France to play in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] elite round qualification campaign, his debut came against the Czech Republic. He played in two further games.{{UEFA player|103891|Morgan Schneiderlin}} On 25 May 2009, he was selected in the [[France national under-20 football team|under-20 squad]] to participate in the [[Football at the 2009 Mediterranean Games|2009 Mediterranean Games]]. Schneiderlin featured in three of the four matches contested as France finished in fifth place. The following year, he appeared with the under-20 team at the [[2010 Toulon Tournament]]. In the opening game of the tournament against [[Colombia national under-20 football team|Colombia U20]], Schneiderlin scored the first goal in the 34th minute, helping his side win the game 2–0.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2055199,00.html |title=Morgan Equals Saints Tally! |publisher=Southampton F.C |date=18 May 2010 |accessdate=18 May 2010}} In July 2010, he was part of France's team that attempted to qualify for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]]. He played against Malta U21s in a 2–0 victory under coach [[Erick Mombaerts]].{{cite web |title=France vs. Malta |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2011/matches/round=2000006/match=2000194/index.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=6 March 2014}} ===Senior=== [[File:Morgan Schneiderlin - France v Armenia 2014.jpg|thumb|upright|Schneiderlin lining up for [[France national football team|France]] in 2014]] In November 2013, various British media outlets reported that Schneiderlin was eligible to represent England.{{cite news |title=Southampton: Morgan Schneiderlin waits for France call |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24912906 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 November 2013 |accessdate=13 November 2013}} Under Article 8.1, Regulations Governing The Application of the Statutes, FIFA Statutes, Schneiderlin is only eligible to represent France at international level as he has played at various age-levels in UEFA competitions prior to gaining British citizenship. On 13 May 2014, [[France national football team|France]] coach [[Didier Deschamps]] named Schneiderlin on the team's standby list for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/13052014-morgan-schneiderlin-world-cup-standby-1550589.aspx |title=Frenchman Schneiderlin on World Cup standby |date=13 May 2014 |accessdate=14 May 2014 |publisher=Southampton F.C.}} He was later called into the full squad following the withdrawal of the injured [[Clément Grenier]].{{cite news |title=France winger Franck Ribery ruled out of World Cup with injury; Grenier also out |url=http://www.foxnews.com/sports/2014/06/06/france-winger-franck-ribery-ruled-out-world-cup-with-injury-grenier-also-out.html |publisher=Fox News |accessdate=21 April 2017}} On 8 June Schneiderlin made his international debut, replacing [[Karim Benzema]] for the final three minutes of an 8–0 friendly win against [[Jamaica national football team|Jamaica]] in [[Lille]].{{cite web |title=France 8–0 Jamaica |url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/386675/gamecast.html |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=8 June 2014 |date=8 June 2014}} His debut in the World Cup came 17 days later, when he played the full 90 minutes of a 0–0 draw with [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] at the [[Estádio Nacional Mané Garrincha]] in Brasília; Deschamps made six changes for this final group match due to France's previous good form.{{cite news |title=Ecuador 0 France 0 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285420 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 June 2014 |date=25 June 2014}} This was his only appearance at the tournament, in which France reached the quarter-finals. Schneiderlin was not initially selected to France's squad for their hosting of [[UEFA Euro 2016]], with Leicester City's [[N'Golo Kanté]] chosen at his expense,{{cite news |last1=Coerts |first1=Stefan |title=Kante, Gignac make France squad for Euro 2016 as Schneiderlin misses out |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/465/france/2016/05/12/23441122/kante-gignac-make-france-squad-for-euro-2016-as-schneiderlin |accessdate=13 May 2016 |website=Goal.com |publisher=Perform Group |date=12 May 2016}} but he was added following an injury to [[Lassana Diarra]].{{cite news |title=Euro 2016: Lassana Diarra ruled out, Morgan Schneiderlin comes in |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36422929 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 June 2016 |date=31 May 2016}} Schneiderlin did not play in any of France's seven matches as they reached the [[UEFA Euro 2016 Final|final]].{{cite web |title=Morgan Schneiderlin |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2017/clubs/player=103891/profile/index.html |publisher=UEFA}} ==Personal life== In March 2016, Schneiderlin became engaged to Camille Sold.{{cite news |last1=McKeegan |first1=Alice |title=Manchester United midfielder Morgan Schneiderlin gets engaged |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-midfielder-morgan-schneiderlin-11118649 |accessdate=31 March 2016 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=31 March 2016}} They married in June 2017.{{cite news |last1=Gorst |first1=Paul |title=Morgan Schneiderlin goes on safari as Everton star kicks off honeymoon in Tanzania |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/morgan-schneiderlin-goes-safari-everton-13223927 |accessdate=3 November 2017 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=22 June 2017}} ==Career {{about|the name|other uses|Bernard (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox given name | name = Bernard | image = File:Stained glass St Bernard MNMA Cl3273.jpg | imagesize = | bcaption = [[Bernard of Clairvaux|Saint Bernard]] | pronunciation = mainly UK: {{IPAc-en|ˈ|b|ɜːr|n|ər|d}}
mainly US: {{IPAc-en|b|ər|ˈ|n|ɑːr|d}}{{cite book|last=Wells|first=John C.|year=2008|title=Longman Pronunciation Dictionary|edition=3rd|publisher=Longman|isbn=978-1-4058-8118-0}}
{{IPA-fr|bɛʁ.naʁ|lang}}
{{IPA-nl|ˈbɛrnɑrt|lang}} | gender = masculine | meaning = | region = medieval Europe | origin = West Germanic | related names = [[Bernie (given name)|Bernie]], [[Barnard]], [[Bernardas]], Bearnárd, [[Bernardo (disambiguation)|Bernardo]], [[Beñat]], [[Bernhard]], [[Bernhardt]], [[Bernd]], [[Bernadette (disambiguation)|Bernadette]], [[Berend]] | footnotes = | wikt = {{wiktionary|Bernard|bernard}} }} '''Bernard''' (''[[Bernhard]]'') is a [[West Germanic]] masculine given name.[[Albert Dauzat]], ''Noms et prénoms de France'', Librairie Larousse 1980. p. 38, New completed edition by [[:fr:Marie-Thérèse Morlet|Marie-Thérèse Morlet]]. The name is attested from at least the 9th century. West Germanic ''Bernhard'' is composed from the two elements ''bern'' "bear" and ''hard'' "brave, hardy".{{cite web|url=http://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=bernhard|title=Name Meaning and Origin|publisher=Ancestry.com|accessdate=2013-06-16}}. T. F. Hoad, ''English Etymology'', Oxford University Press 1993. p. 36. Its native Old English reflex was ''Beornheard'', which was replaced by the Old French form ''Bernard'' after the Norman conquest. The name ''Bernhard'' was notably popular among [[Old Frisian]] speakers.[https://archive.org/stream/diekosenamender00stargoog#page/n189/mode/2up Die Kosenamen der Germanen: Eine Studie], [[:de:Franz Stark (Philologe)|Franz Stark]], 1868 (German) Its wider use was popularized due to Saint [[Bernhard of Clairvaux]] (canonized 1174). ==Geographical distribution== As of 2014, 42.2% of all known bearers of the surname ''Bernard'' were residents of [[France]] (frequency 1:392), 12.5% of the [[United States]] (1:7,203), 7.0% of [[Haiti]] (1:382), 6.6% of [[Tanzania]] (1:1,961), 4.8% of [[Canada]] (1:1,896), 3.6% of [[Nigeria]] (1:12,221), 2.7% of [[Burundi]] (1:894), 1.9% of [[Belgium]] (1:1,500), 1.6% of [[Rwanda]] (1:1,745), 1.2% of [[Germany]] (1:16,397), 1.2% of [[Jamaica]] (1:595), 1.1% of [[Ghana]] (1:6,179), 1.0% of [[England]] (1:13,691) and 1.0% of [[Madagascar]] (1:6,098). In [[France]], the frequency of the surname was higher than national average (1:392) in the following regions:[https://forebears.io/surnames/bernard Bernard surname distribution] * 1. [[Collectivity of Saint Martin]] (1:60) * 2. [[Saint Barthélemy]] (1:189) * 3. [[Bourgogne-Franche-Comté]] (1:260) * 4. [[Nouvelle-Aquitaine]] (1:283) * 5. [[Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes]] (1:296) * 6. [[Brittany (administrative region)|Brittany]] (1:333) * 7. [[Pays de la Loire]] (1:336) * 8. [[Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur]] (1:348) * 9.
