{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2018}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Muhamed Bešić |fullname = Muhamed Bešić |image = Muhamed Besic 2014-05-03.jpg |image_size = |caption = Bešić with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2014 |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|9|10|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Berlin]], Germany |height = 1.77 m{{cite web|url=http://uefa.com/uefaeuro-finals/season=2016/teams/player=250022319/index.html|title=Player profile: Muhamed Bešić|website=uefa.com|accessdate=20 December 2017}} |position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) |clubnumber = 37 |youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = SpVgg Tiergarten |youthyears2 = |youthclubs2 = [[Füchse Berlin Reinickendorf|Reinickendorfer Füchse]] |youthyears3 = 2007–2009 |youthclubs3 = [[Tennis Borussia Berlin|TB Berlin]] |youthyears4 = 2009–2010 |youthclubs4 = [[Hamburger SV]] |years1 = 2010–2012 |clubs1 = [[Hamburger SV II]] |caps1 = 38 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2010–2012 |clubs2 = [[Hamburger SV]] |caps2 = 3 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2012–2014 |clubs3 = [[Ferencvárosi TC (football)|Ferencváros]] |caps3 = 47 |goals3 = 1 |years4 = 2014– |clubs4 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps4 = 37 |goals4 = 0 |years5 = 2018 |clubs5 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) |caps5 = 15 |goals5 = 1 |years6 = 2018– |clubs6 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) |caps6 = 27 |goals6 = 2 |nationalyears1 = 2010–2012 |nationalteam1 = [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina U21]] |nationalcaps1 = 10 |nationalgoals1 = 2 |nationalyears2 = 2010– |nationalteam2 = [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] |nationalcaps2 = 36 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |club-update = 2 March 2019 |nationalteam-update = 18 November 2018 }} '''Muhamed Bešić''' ({{IPA-sh|muxǎmed běʃitɕ|bs}}; born 10 September 1992) is a Bosnian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Middlesbrough F.C|Middlesbrough]], on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], and the [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina national team]]. Bešić started his professional career at [[Hamburger SV]], playing mainly in its [[Hamburger SV II|reserve team]], before moving to [[Ferencvárosi TC (football)|Ferencváros]] in 2012. Two years later he joined Everton. He was loaned to Middlesbrough in 2018. A former youth international for Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bešić made his senior international debut in 2010, and is the youngest player ever to represent the country. He made over 30 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] since and represented the nation at their first major tournament, the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Berlin]] to Bosnian parents, Bešić joined local club [[Tennis Borussia Berlin|TB Berlin]] at the age of 14, where he remained until he was 16, when he signed for [[Hamburger SV]].{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/middlesbrough-je-raskrsnica-za-karijeru-muhameda-besica/267125|title=Middlesbrough je raskrsnica za karijeru Muhameda Bešića|website=sportsport.ba|date=4 February 2018|accessdate=5 February 2018|language=Bosnian}} On 4 November 2010, Bešić signed his first professional contract with Hamburger SV until June 2013.{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/besic-do-ljeta-2013-godine-u-hamburgu/46128|title=Bešić do ljeta 2013. godine u Hamburgu|website=sportsport.ba|date=5 November 2010|accessdate=3 July 2011|language=Bosnian}} He made his professional debut in [[Bundesliga]] game against [[Borussia Dortmund]] on 12 November 2010 at the age of 18. Bešić came on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the 80th minute when Dortmund was already leading 2–0.{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/besic-debitovao-za-hamburg/46548|title=Bešić debitovao za Hamburg|website=sportsport.ba|date=12 November 2010|accessdate=13 November 2010|language=Bosnian}} A week later, he started his first Bundesliga game away at [[Hannover 96]], and played full 90 minutes in a 3–2 loss.{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/ibisevic-postigao-dva-gola-u-dvije-minute-mujdza-zabio-autogol/101120062|title=Ibišević postigao dva gola u dvije minute, Mujdža zabio autogol|website=klix.ba|date=20 November 2010|accessdate=23 November 2010|language=Bosnian}} In March 2012, Bešić was suspended from the first team, due to lack of discipline. Bosnian media also claimed that manager [[Thorsten Fink]] "strangled" Bešić and threw him out of the dressing room.{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/fink-daveci-izbacio-besica-iz-svlacionice/77473|title=Fink daveći izbacio Bešića iz svlačionice|website=sportsport.ba|date=28 March 2012|accessdate=31 March 2012|language=Bosnian}} ===Ferencváros=== In 2012 Bešić was signed by Hungarian club [[Ferencvárosi TC (football)|Ferencváros]] on [[Free transfer (association football)|free transfer]].{{cite news|url=http://scsport.ba/vijesti/jos-jedan-bh-internacionalac-u-madjarskoj-kiso-potpisao-za-debrecen/42936|title=Još jedan bh internacionalac u Mađarskoj, Kiso potpisao za Debrecen|website=scsport.ba|date=2 June 2012|accessdate=12 September 2017|language=Bosnian}} He scored his first and only goal for the club in an away victory over [[Paksi FC|Paksi]], which was also his first professional goal.{{cite news|url=https://24.hu/sport/foci/2013/05/05/nem-adja-magat-konnyen-a-fradi/|title=Nem adja magát könnyen a Fradi|website=24.hu|date=5 May 2013|accessdate=21 July 2018|language=Hungarian}} In his first season, he helped the team win [[Ligakupa]] by beating [[MOL Vidi FC|MOL Vidi]] in the final.{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/predstavljamo-zmajeve-muhamed-besic-je-zvijezda-u-usponu/140531097|title=Predstavljamo Zmajeve: Muhamed Bešić je zvijezda u usponu|website=klix.ba|date=1 June 2014|accessdate=6 March 2016|language=Bosnian}} In July 2013, Bešić prolonged his contract with Ferencváros until 2016.{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/muhamed-besic-u-ferencvarosu-do-2016-godine/109020|title=Muhamed Bešić u Ferencvarošu do 2016. godine|website=sportsport.ba|date=12 July 2013|accessdate=3 November 2014|language=Bosnian}} ===Everton=== On 28 July 2014 Bešić signed a five-year contract with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] for an undisclosed fee, speculated to be in the region of £4 million.{{cite news|url=http://liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/everton-complete-4m-signing-muhamed-7522246|title=Everton complete £4m signing of Muhamed Besic from Ferencvaros|website=liverpoolecho.co.uk|date=28 July 2014|accessdate=28 July 2014}} Having been an unused substitute in the first two games of the season, he made his first [[Premier League]] appearance on 30 August against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], replacing [[Romelu Lukaku]] in the 89th minute; however he made a defensive error which allowed opponent [[Diego Costa]] to score the final goal in a 3–6 home defeat.{{cite news|url=http://dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2738380/Everton-3-6-Chelsea-Quickfire-Diego-Costa-sparks-goal-rush-Blues-maintain-perfect-start.html|title=Everton 3-6 Chelsea: Quickfire Diego Costa sparks goal rush as Blues maintain perfect start|website=dailymail.co.uk|date=30 August 2014|accessdate=2 November 2014}} Bešić made his first start for Everton in the [[Merseyside derby]] on 27 September, being substituted after 80 minutes for [[Samuel Eto'o]] as the game ended in a 1–1 away draw.{{cite news|url=https://mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/liverpool-1-1-everton-phil-jagielka-4332406|title=Liverpool 1-1 Everton: Phil Jagielka wonder strike secures late point for the Toffees|website=mirror.co.uk|date=27 September 2014|accessdate=2 November 2014}} His second season at Everton was plagued by [[hamstring]] injuries, which limited his appearances and playing time.{{cite news|url=http://espn.in/football/everton/story/2542958/muhamed-besic-to-miss-start-of-everton-season-for-hamstring|title=Everton's Muhamed to miss start of season with injured hamstring|website=espn.in|date=30 July 2015|accessdate=5 August 2016}}{{cite news|url=http://sportsmole.co.uk/football/everton/injury-news/news/besic-injury-absence-frustrating_258292.html|title=Muhamed Besic: Injury absence is frustrating|website=sportsmole.co.uk|date=20 November 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-blow-mo-besic-suffers-10781429|title=Everton blow as Mo Besic suffers recurrence of hamstring injury|website=liverpoolecho.co.uk|date=24 January 2016|accessdate=31 January 2016}} In February 2016 he was voted Everton's Player of the Month for January.{{cite news|url=http://liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mo-besic-everton-player-month-10906801|title=Mo Besic is Everton Player of the Month for January|website=liverpoolecho.co.uk|date=17 February 2016|accessdate=23 February 2016}} He also extended his contract until June 2021.{{cite news|url=http://skysports.com/football/news/11671/10186863/muhamed-besic-has-signed-a-deal-which-will-keep-him-at-everton-until-2021|title=Muhamed Besic signs new Everton deal until the summer of 2021|website=skysports.com|date=29 February 2016|accessdate=24 March 2016}} In August 2016, Bešić was ruled out for about six month as he [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|tore anterior cruciate ligament]] in his right knee.{{cite news|url=https://bbc.com/sport/football/36983793|title=Muhamed Besic: Everton midfielder out for six months with knee injury|website=bbc.com|date=5 August 2016|accessdate=5 August 2016}} Bešić was slowly making his way back to full fitness as he was involved with Everton Under-23s' in mid-April 2017.{{cite news|url=http://royalbluemersey.sbnation.com/2017/4/15/15310250/everton-burnley-injury-report-match-preview-besic-two-weeks-schneiderlin|title=Besic still a couple of weeks away for Everton|website=royalbluemersey.com|date=15 April 2017|accessdate=16 April 2017}} He missed the whole [[2016–17 Everton F.C. season|2016–17]] campaign, not playing a single minute for Everton, before eventually returning to action coming on as a 77th-minute substitute for his national team on 9 June 2017.{{cite news|url=http://liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-midfielder-muhamed-besic-gets-13168238|title=Everton midfielder Muhamed Besic gets much-needed action in Bosnia draw|website=liverpoolecho.co.uk|date=10 June 2017|accessdate=21 July 2017}} Bešić returned to Premier League action on 21 August 2017, almost 16 months since his last game, in a 1–1 away draw at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite news|url=https://telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/21/manchester-city-vs-everton-premier-league-live/|title=Wayne Rooney scores but Raheem Sterling levels it as both sides finish with ten|website=telegraph.co.uk|date=21 August 2017|accessdate=25 August 2017}} After falling out of favor at Everton, in January 2018, Bešić joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news|url=https://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42898285|title=Middlesbrough sign Everton's Muhamed Besic and Huddersfield's Martin Cranie|website=bbc.co.uk|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=1 February 2018}} He debuted on 17 February against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].{{cite news|url=https://walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/cardiff-citys-energy-levels-scale-14304067|title=Cardiff City's energy levels are off the scale once again as Middlesbrough become the latest victims of a Neil Warnock masterclass|website=walesonline.co.uk|date=18 February 2018|accessdate=18 February 2018}} Bešić scored his first goal for Middlesbrough, which was also his first goal in over four years, against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on 21 April.{{cite news|url=http://dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5641875/Derby-1-2-Middlesbrough-Muhamed-Besic-Britt-Assombalonga-dent-Rams-play-hopes-away-win.html|title=Derby 1-2 Middlesbrough: Muhamed Besic and Britt Assombalonga dent Rams play-off hopes in away win|website=dailymail.co.uk|date=21 April 2018|accessdate=22 April 2018}} Bešić returned to Middlesbrough on a season-long loan in August 2018.{{cite news|url=http://dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-6090633/Middlesbrough-confirm-signing-Everton-midfielder-Mo-Besic-one-year-loan.html|title=Middlesbrough confirm the signing of Everton midfielder Mo Besic on one-year loan|website=dailymail.co.uk|date=23 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018}} ==International career== [[File:20150331 2213 AUT BIH 2666.jpg|thumb|Bešić playing for [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] in 2015]] Bešić claimed in an interview that he had declined an offer to play for [[Germany national football team|Germany]], because he only wished to play for [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]].{{cite news|url=https://faktor.ba/vijest/besic-imao-samo-poziv-njemacke-srce-je-odabralo-bih/7305|title=Bešić: Imao sam poziv Njemačke, srce je odabralo BiH|website=klix.ba|date=14 October 2018|accessdate=16 October 2018|language=Bosnian}} He was first part of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina under-21]] side.{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/muhamed-besic-spahicev-nasljednik-i-vodja-u-21-reprezentacije/130609013|title=Muhamed Bešić, Spahićev nasljednik i vođa U21 reprezentacije|website=klix.ba|date=9 June 2013|accessdate=12 June 2013|language=Bosnian}} On 5 November 2010, Bešić was called-up to the senior team by [[Safet Sušić]] for [[Exhibition game|friendly]] game against [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]].{{cite news|url=https://radiosarajevo.ba/sport/nogomet/debi-besica-povratak-salihovica-i-zeca/36734|title=Debi Bešića, povratak Salihovića i Zeca|website=radiosarajevo.ba|date=5 November 2010|accessdate=7 November 2010|language=Bosnian}} He made his debut in that match, thereby becoming the youngest player to ever play for Bosnia and Herzegovina at senior level. The record was previously held by [[Miralem Pjanić]].{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/zmajevi-preokrenuli-protiv-slovaka-za-vaznu-pobjedu/101117098|title=Zmajevi preokrenuli protiv Slovaka za važnu pobjedu|website=klix.ba|date=17 November 2010|accessdate=18 November 2010|language=Bosnian}} Bešić was selected to play for Bosnia and Herzegovina at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], country's first ever major competition.{{cite news|url=https://telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/bosnia-and-herzegovina/10810419/Bosnia-Herzegovina-World-Cup-2014-squad.html|title=Bosnia and Herzegovina 2014 World Cup squad|website=telegraph.co.uk|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=4 June 2014}} He made his tournament debut in the opening group game, which ended in a narrow loss to [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium]],{{cite news|url=https://fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255931/match=300186477/match-report.html|title=Bosnia beaten by Messi marvel|website=fifa.com|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=18 June 2014}} He was given a straight red card on 6 September 2015, in a 3–0 home win over [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] in [[UEFA Euro 2016]] qualifying game for throwing his chewing gum at [[Víctor Rodríguez (Andorran footballer)|Víctor Rodríguez]], who was also sent off for retaliating.{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/bih-u-nervoznoj-utakmici-lako-slavila-protiv-andore/170984|title=BiH u nervoznoj utakmici lako slavila protiv Andore|website=sportsport.ba|date=6 September 2015|accessdate=6 September 2015|language=Bosnian}} ==Style of play== During his career, Bešić has been deployed as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] and as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre back]], although his natural position by his own words is [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]].{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/muhamed-besic-za-klix-ba-sada-igram-na-poziciji-desnog-beka-i-dobro-mi-ide/140405078|title=Muhamed Bešić: Sada igram na poziciji desnog beka i dobro mi ide|website=klix.ba|date=5 April 2014|accessdate=6 April 2014|language=Bosnian}} He was described in 2014 by Everton manager [[Roberto Martínez]] as a "very complete footballer", who "has got a very natural balance about knowing that he can be strong and aggressive but in the same way he's a technical player on the ball."{{cite news|url=https://sportsport.ba/fudbal/martinez-besic-ima-predispozicije-za-nevjerovatnu-karijeru/137921|title=Martínez: Bešić ima predispozicije za nevjerovatnu karijeru|website=sportsport.ba|date=14 August 2014|accessdate=16 August 2014|language=Bosnian}} ==Personal life== Bešić has many [[tattoos]], his first being the word ''Bosanac'' ([[Bosnians|Bosnian]]). Some of many are also names of his parents and brother.{{cite news|url=https://radiosarajevo.ba/sport/nogomet/zmajevi-i-tetovaze-kakvi-crtezi-krase-tijela-bh-fudbalera-foto/206711|title=Zmajevi i tetovaže: Kakvi crteži krase tijela bh fudbalera|website=radiosarajevo.ba|date=23 November 2015|accessdate=25 November 2015|language=Bosnian}} He is a [[Muslim]]; along with international team mates [[Vedad Ibišević]] and [[Edin Višća]] he visited a [[mosque]] in [[Cuiabá]] during the 2014 FIFA World Cup.{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/bh-navijaci-i-reprezentativci-obavili-dzuma-namaz-u-cuiabi/140620159|title=Navijači i reprezentativci obavili džuma-namaz u Cuiabi|website=klix.ba|date=21 June 2014|accessdate=24 June 2014|language=Bosnian}} On 4 July 2013, he became the Bosnian ambassador for the [[Emmaus (charity)|Emmaus charity organisation]].{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/muhamed-besic-posjetio-udruzenje-emmaus-iz-doboj-istoka/130703022|title=Muhamed Bešić posjetio udruženje Emmaus iz Doboj Istoka|website=klix.ba|date=4 July 2013|accessdate=5 July 2013|language=Bosnian}} Bešić has two daughters with his long-time girlfriend Jessica.{{cite news|url=https://klix.ba/sport/nogomet/muhamed-besic-za-klix-ba-kcerke-su-me-promijenile-na-teren-cu-se-vratiti-s-puno-zelje-i-strasti/170311062|title=Muhamed Bešić: Kćerke su me promijenile, na teren ću se vratiti s puno želje i strasti|website=klix.ba|date=11 March 2017|accessdate=13 March 2017|language=Bosnian}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 23 February 2019.}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/muhamed-besic/144829/|title=M. Bešić|website=soccerway.com|accessdate=23 February 2019}} {|class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|Cup !colspan=2|League Cup {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Kieran Dowell |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Kieran O'Neill Dowell{{cite web |title=Barclays Premier League Squad Lists 2014/15 published |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/sep/premier-league-squad-lists-2014-2015.html |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=11 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150105225000/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/sep/premier-league-squad-lists-2014-2015.html |archivedate=5 January 2015}} |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1997|10|10|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Kieran Dowell |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/kieran-dowell-248413/ |website=11v11.com |accessdate=16 April 2016}} |birth_place = [[Ormskirk]], England |height = {{convert|1.75|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/10455/Kieran-Dowell/overview |title=Kieran Dowell: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=28 July 2018}} |position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (On loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) |clubnumber = 8 |youthyears1 = 2005–2014 |youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton]] |years1 = 2014– |clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps1 = 2 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2017–2018 |clubs2 = → [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] (loan) |caps2 = 38 |goals2 = 9 |years3 = 2019– |clubs3 = → [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (loan) |caps3 = 11 |goals3 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 7 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 16 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2017– | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 11 | nationalgoals5 = 2 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 20:25, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:30, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kieran O'Neill Dowell''' (born 10 October 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]]. ==Club career== ===Everton=== Born in [[Ormskirk]], Lancashire, Dowell joined Everton's academy at the age of 7.{{cite web |title=Kieran Dowell |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/k/kd/kieran-dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |accessdate=11 December 2014}} After progressing through the ranks and the reserve side, he signed a scholarship with the club in June 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/06/28/15-become-scholars |title=15 Become Scholars |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=28 June 2014 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104135538/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/06/28/15-become-scholars |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/26/next-generation-kieran-dowell |title=Next Generation: Kieran Dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=26 May 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104143842/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/26/next-generation-kieran-dowell |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} He then scored in a friendly for the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton U21]] side, in a 1–0 win over [[Rhyl F.C.|Rhyl]] on 26 July 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/07/26/report-everton-u21s-10-rhyl |title=Report: Everton U21s 1–0 Rhyl |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=26 July 2014 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104131758/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/07/26/report-everton-u21s-10-rhyl |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} Dowell made his debut for the club on 11 December 2014, replacing the injured [[Christian Atsu]] 11 minutes into a [[UEFA Europa League]] group match against [[FC Krasnodar]] at [[Goodison Park]]. Everton, who had already advanced into the next round, lost 0–1.{{cite news |title=Everton 0–1 FK Krasnodar |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30333966 |accessdate=11 December 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 December 2014}} With his only first team appearances of the season, he signed his first professional contract with the club. After being given a number 51 shirt in the 2015–16 season, Dowell, however, suffered ankle injury that saw him sidelined for two months.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/09/02/aaron-opts-for-12-shirt |title=Lennon To Wear Number 12 |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=2 September 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104133616/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/09/02/aaron-opts-for-12-shirt |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Everton prospect Kieran Dowell could miss two months after ankle surgery |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/everton-prospect-kieran-dowell-could-9893322 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=20 August 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} He scored on his return for the Everton U21 on 6 December 2015, in a 3–1 win over [[Liverpool F.C. Reserves and Academy|Liverpool U23]].{{cite news |title=Are these two Everton's midfield axis of the future? |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/two-evertons-midfield-axis-future-10557508 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=6 December 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell went on to score nine more goals for the reserve side, including a stunner against [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Southampton U21]] and a hat-trick against [[Leicester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Leicester City U23]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2015-2016/barclays-premier-u21-league/everton-u21-vs-southampton-u21/match |title=Match Report: Everton U21 v Southampton U21 |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=15 February 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170204231438/http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2015-2016/barclays-premier-u21-league/everton-u21-vs-southampton-u21/match |archivedate=4 February 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Watch Kieran Dowell's stunning Everton hat trick as he continues to knock on first-team door |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/watch-kieran-dowells-stunning-everton-11242511 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=26 April 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} On 30 April 2016, he made his [[Premier League]] debut as an 87th-minute substitute for [[Ross Barkley]] in a 2–1 home win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite news |title=Everton 2 – 1 AFC Bournemouth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36118581 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 April 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell then started the final game of the 2015–16 season against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] at Goodison Park.{{cite news |title=Everton 3 – 1 Norwich City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240381 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Two months after making his Premier League debut, Dowell signed a three-year contract with the club, keeping him until 2019.{{cite news |title=Kieran Dowell signs revised three-year contract with Everton |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/everton/story/2900715/kieran-dowell-signs-revised-three-year-contract-with-everton |publisher=ESPN |date=23 June 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} In the 2016–17 season, Dowell was a member of the Everton U23 squad to win the inaugural Premier League 2 title, in which he made the total of 22 appearances and scoring 5 times.{{cite news |title=Meet new Nottingham Forest signing Kieran Dowell – the teenager with a cracking shot and fine left foot |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/football-news/meet-new-nottingham-forest-signing-276535 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/04/25/under23s-story-of-the-season |title=Under-23s: Story of the season |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=25 April 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150326/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/04/25/under23s-story-of-the-season |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} His performance throughout April won him April's Premier League 2 Player of the Month.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/12/honour-for-under23s-midfielder |title=Under-23s Midfielder Wins Award |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=12 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150044/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/12/honour-for-under23s-midfielder |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} ====Nottingham Forest (loan)==== On 3 August 2017, Dowell signed on a season-long loan with [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].{{cite web |url=https://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/2017/august/dowell-joins-on-loan/ |title=Dowell joins on loan |publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C. |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104160619/https://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/2017/august/dowell-joins-on-loan/ |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Done deal: Kieran Dowell joins Nottingham Forest on season-long loan from Everton |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/transfer-news/done-deal-kieran-dowell-joins-267717 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell made his Nottingham Forest debut, coming on as a second-half substitute, in a 1–0 win over [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] in the opening game of the season.{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest 1 – 0 Millwall |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40748927 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} He scored his first goal for Forest in a 4–3 win at [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 12 August 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40834645 |title=Brentford 3–4 Nottingham Forest |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 August 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}} Since making his Nottingham Forest debut, he became a first team regular.{{cite news |title=Kieran Dowell, Barrie McKay and Tendayi Darikwa earn top marks from Nottingham Forest fans as they 'Rate The Players' |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/kieran-dowell-barrie-mckay-tendayi-287284 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest's Kieran Dowell loving 'every minute' of whirlwind few months in his career |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/nottingham-forests-kieran-dowell-loving-417376 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell scored again on 30 September 2017, in a 2–1 win over [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest 2–1 Sheffield United: Blades charge ends |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/n-forest-vs-sheff-utd/374746 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Four weeks later, on 28 October 2017, he scored his first ever hat-trick, in a 3–2 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].{{cite news |title=Hull City 2 – Nottingham Forest 3: Kieran Dowell hits hat-trick to tame Tigers |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/872299/Hull-City-Nottingham-Forest-Live-Stream-Championship |newspaper=Daily Express |date=28 October 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} After the match, Dowell's performance was praised by local newspaper ''[[Nottingham Post]]'' and the club's supporters.{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest hat-trick hero Kieran Dowell scored two 'absolute belters' |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/nottingham-forest-hat-trick-hero-695854 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=28 October 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} ==== Sheffield United (loan) ==== On 28 December 2018, it was announced that Dowell would join [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] as of 2 January 2019 on loan for the rest of the season. ==International career== After representing England at lower youth levels, Dowell was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] for the first time, making his debut in a 1–1 draw against [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil]] alongside Everton teammate [[Dominic Calvert-Lewin]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/01/international-blues |title=International Blues |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104144833/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/01/international-blues |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/02/international-round-up |title=International Round-Up |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=2 September 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104144840/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/02/international-round-up |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} In May 2017, Dowell was selected for the England U20 in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/25/dowell-raring-to-go |title=Dowell Raring To Go |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=25 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150544/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/25/dowell-raring-to-go |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} After setting up two goals in a 3–0 win over [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina]] on Matchday 1 of the group stage, he scored the only goal against hosts [[South Korea national under-20 football team|South Korea]], ensuring a place in the second round for England.{{cite news |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Argentina 3–0 in opening match |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39984863 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/26/england-progress-under-20-world-cup |title=Everton's Kieran Dowell seals top spot for England at Under-20 World Cup |date=26 May 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian}} He also started in the final, in which England beat [[Venezuela national under-20 football team|Venezuela]] 1–0 for England's first triumph in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory in 1966.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 June 2017}} Following the end of the 2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup, Dowell was called up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] squad, for whom he made his debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] on 1 September 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/28/blues-world-cup-winners-in-england-under21-squad |title=Five Blues Named in England Under-21s Squad |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=28 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104151957/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/28/blues-world-cup-winners-in-england-under21-squad |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/01/calvert-lewin-on-target-for-young-lions |title=Calvert-Lewin on target for Young Lions |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104152041/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/01/calvert-lewin-on-target-for-young-lions |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} ==Personal life== Born in [[Ormskirk]], England, Dowell grew up supporting Everton, the team he would eventually play for, and idolised [[Mikel Arteta]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/01/my-football-hero-kieran-dowell |title=My Football Hero: Kieran Dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 July 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150625/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/01/my-football-hero-kieran-dowell |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} While at the academy, he was a ball-boy when he was 14.{{cite news |title=Everton starlet Kieran Dowell Q&A;: Studying David Silva, worshipping Arteta and itching for a first team chance |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-starlet-kieran-dowell-qa-11082083 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=26 March 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} At 20, he moved out of his parents' house for an apartment.{{cite news |title=Everton youngster Kieran Dowell on Nottingham Forest, England and... getting his Sky fixed |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-youngster-kieran-dowell-nottingham-13565892 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=3 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 19 January 2019}}{{soccerway|kieran-dowell/392787|accessdate=5 October 2017}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by {{Infobox football biography | name = Beni Baningime | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Beni Tangama Baningime{{cite web|title=List of Players Registered as Scholars in Accordance with Rule C.3 Between 01/07/2015 and 31/07/2015|url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/july-2015.ashx|publisher=TheFA.com|accessdate=2 November 2017|page=45|format=pdf|date=27 November 2015}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|9|9|df=y}}{{cite web|title=Beni Baningime|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/b/bb/beni-baningime|publisher=Everton F.C.|accessdate=26 October 2017}} | birth_place = [[Kinshasa]], DR Congo | height = {{height|m=1.78}} | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 2007–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 8 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2019– | clubs2 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | club-update = 10:40, 20 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Beni Tangama Baningime''' (born 9 September 1998) is a Congolese-English{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/clubs/player=250116613/index.html|title=Beni Baningime|date=2 November 2017|publisher=UEFA}} professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[central midfielder]] for English club [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on loan from [[Everton F.C|Everton]]. ==Career== Baningime joined Everton at the age of nine.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-beni-baningime-evertons-midfield-13812458|title=Meet Beni Baningime — the midfield prodigy likened to Kante|first=Adam|last=Jones|date=25 October 2017|publisher=}} He is an academy graduate of the club and won honours such as 'The Premier League 2'{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/everton/story/3111722/everton-under-23s-win-premier-league-2-title?src=com|title=Everton U23s win Premier League 2 title|publisher=}} and the [[Dallas Cup]]{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/03/27/dallas-cup-final-report|title=So Close... - Everton Football Club|website=www.evertonfc.com}} during his time in the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy]]. Baningime also won the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy]] Player of the Year award for the 2016/17 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/18/baningime-takes-top-academy-prize|title=So Close... - Everton Football Club|website=www.evertonfc.com}} Baningime's senior debut came in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] game against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in October 2017.{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/beni-baningime-shock-everton-debut-13812892|title=This is what David Unsworth thought of Baningime's debut|last=Doyle|first=Ian|date=2017-10-25|work=liverpoolecho|accessdate=2017-10-26}} Baningime made his [[Premier League]] debut as a half-time substitute against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 29 October 2017.{{Cite web|url=https://www.footballfallout.com/premier-league-2017-2018/game/leicester-city-vs-everton-29-10-2017|title=Leicester City v Everton|website=Football Fallout|language=en-gb|accessdate=2017-11-03}}
In January 2019, he was loaned to [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2019/january/wigan-athletic-sign-everton-midfielder-beni-baningime-on-loan-until-the-end-of-the-season/|title=WIGAN ATHLETIC SIGN EVERTON MIDFIELDER BENI BANINGIME ON LOAN UNTIL THE END OF THE SEASON|publisher=Wigan Athletic F.C.|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=7 February 2019}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 14 April 2018}} {{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/beni-baningime/453276/ |title=B. Baningime |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=25 October 2017}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|FA Cup !colspan=2|League Cup !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=1|[[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |[[2017–18 Everton F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[Premier League]] |8||0||0||0||1||0||3{{efn|Appearance(s) in [[UEFA Europa League]]|name=UEL}}||0||11||0 |- !colspan=3|Career total !8!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0!!3!!0!!11!!0 |} {{notelist}} ==Personal life== Baningime has a brother named [[Divin Baningime]], who is a Congolese footballer for [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic.]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2017/october/find-out-more-about-latics-academy-graduate-involved-tonight-against-middlesbrough-u23/|title=Find Out More About Latics' Academy Graduates Involved Tonight Against Middlesbrough U21 |publisher=Wigan Athletic|date=24 October 2017|accessdate=8 November 2017 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{soccerway|beni-baningime/453276}} {{Wigan Athletic F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baningime, Beni}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo footballers]] [[Category:Everton F.C. players]] [[Category:Wigan Athletic F.C. players]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:People from Kinshasa]] [[Category:English people of Democratic Republic of the Congo descent]] [[Category:Premier League players]] [[Category:English footballers]] {{DRCongo-footy-bio-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Matthew Pennington | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Matthew Pennington{{cite web |title = List of Players under Written Contract Registered Between 01/02/2014 and 28/02/2014 |url = http://www.thefa.com/~/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/february-2014.ashx |publisher = The Football Association |format = PDF |page = 13 |accessdate = 6 April 2014}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|10|6|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Warrington]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/matthew-pennington |title=Barclays Premier League Player Profile Matthew Pennington |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=6 November 2012}} | position = [[Centre back]] | currentclub = [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton]] | years1 = 2013– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 7 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2014 | clubs2 = → [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] (loan) | caps2 = 17 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2016 | clubs4 = → [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] (loan) | caps4 = 5 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2017–2018 | clubs5 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) | caps5 = 24 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps6 = 25 | goals6 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 15:41, 12 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Matthew Pennington''' (born 6 October 1994) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. He has represented the [[England national under-19 football team]] (the England U19s) at the international level. ==Club career== ===Everton=== Pennington joined [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at the age of 11. In July 2013, he signed a new contract which would keep him at the club until the summer of 2015,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/player-profile/matthew-pennington|title=So Close...|publisher=Everton F.C.}} followed by a three-year deal taking him to 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/07/matthew-pens-new-deal|title=Matthew Pens New Deal|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He played in two friendlies during July 2015 against [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] and [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] and then made his full debut against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] on 26 August 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/08/27/martinez-praises-debutant-pennington|title=Martinez Praises Debutant Pennington|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Tranmere Rovers (loan)==== On 2 January 2014, Pennington joined [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] on a one month's loan deal.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25568665|title=Tranmere Rovers: Liam Ridehalgh rejoins ahead of permanent deal|publisher=BBC Sport}} He made his debut on 4 January 2014, playing ninety minutes in a 1–1 draw with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/01/01/england/league-one/tranmere-rovers-fc/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/1484848/|title=Tranmere Rovers vs. Wolverhampton Wanderers – 1 January 2014 |website=Soccerway}} On 25 January 2014, he scored his first senior goal in a 1–0 win over [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/01/25/england/league-one/tranmere-rovers-fc/crewe-alexandra-fc/1484894/|title=Tranmere Rovers vs. Crewe Alexandra – 25 January 2014 |website=Soccerway}} He was recalled by Everton on 22 February 2014 to strengthen their under-21 squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20140224/matthew-kennedy-and-matthew-pennington-recalled-from-tranmere-rovers_2293324_3684860|title=Latest Sky Bet League 1 News|publisher=The Football League|access-date=16 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140316061656/http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20140224/matthew-kennedy-and-matthew-pennington-recalled-from-tranmere-rovers_2293324_3684860#|archive-date=16 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 27 March 2014, he re-joined Tranmere on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2014/03/27/trio-loaned-out|title=So Close...|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Coventry (loan)==== On 27 November 2014, Pennington joined [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on loan until 4 January,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/11/27/pennington-loaned-to-coventry|title=Pennington Loaned To Coventry|publisher=Everton F.C.}} and this was subsequently extended to 7 February.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30637098|title=Matty Pennington: Everton defender extends Coventry loan|publisher=BBC Sport}} In January 2015, he was voted as the club's Player of the Month in a poll conducted by the ''[[Coventry Telegraph]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/everton-loan-star-matthew-pennington-8411797|title=Everton loan star Matthew Pennington is YOUR Coventry City Telegraph Player of the Month|author=Aidan McCartney|date=9 January 2015|newspaper=Coventry Telegraph}} On 7 February 2015, his loan was extended to the end of the season, with Pennington from then on being played more consistently at his more natural centre back position.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31312083|title=Matthew Pennington: Coventry City extend defender's loan deal|publisher=BBC Sport}} Pennington was named as Coventry City Young Player of the Year 2014–15, voted for unanimously by Coventry City manager Tony Mowbray and his coaching staff.{{cite web|url=http://www.ccfc.co.uk/news/article/matthew-pennington-young-player-coventry-city-2444127.aspx|title=Matthew Pennington voted as the Coventry City 2014/15 Young Player of the Year|author=Kieran Crowley|publisher=Coventry City F.C.}}{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/06/pennington-picks-up-sky-blues-award|title=Pennington picks up Sky Blues award|publisher=Everton F.C.}} ====Walsall (loan)==== On 23 March 2016, Pennington joined [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on loan until the end of the season,{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/03/24/pennington-loaned-to-walsall|title=Pennington loaned to Walsall|publisher=Everton F.C.}} where he played 5 games at the club, before Everton activated a recall clause just 28 days into his loan spell. ====Everton return==== On 21 April 2016, his loan was terminated at the minimum 28-day point due to a defensive crisis at his home club.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-recall-matthew-pennington-loan-11223814|title=Everton recall Matthew Pennington|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He was recalled to be available for Everton's FA Cup semi-final against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. After picking up a hamstring injury in the final day of the [[Premier League]] 2015/16 season on 15 May 2016 in a 3–0 victory against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]],{{cite web|title=Everton 3 Norwich 0|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240381|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=15 May 2016|accessdate=15 May 2016|first=Neil|last=Johnstone}} a recurrence of the injury in pre-season required surgery and ruled Pennington out until January 2017.{{cite web|title=Pennington on comeback trail|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/01/09/pennington-on-comeback-trail|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=8 January 2017|accessdate=18 July 2017|first=Rob|last=Urbani}} After returning from injury, his first goal came on 1 April 2017, in the [[Merseyside derby]] against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], equalising the game at 1–1, in an eventual 3–1 loss.{{cite web|title=Liverpool 3–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39390276|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 April 2017|accessdate=1 April 2017|quote=Jagielka flicked on a corner at the near post and, after Ashley Williams got a touch, Matthew Pennington arrived to slot in his first Everton goal on his first appearance of the season.|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera}} ====Leeds United (loan)==== On 19 July 2017, Pennington joined [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on a season-long loan,{{cite web|title=Everton Defender Joins on Loan| url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/22082/pennington-leeds|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=19 July 2017}}{{cite|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/18/pennington|title=Pennington joins Leeds on loan|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=19 July 2017}} for a reported loan fee of £500,000.{{cite web|publisher=talkSPORT|date=4 September 2017|url=https://talksport.com/radio/listen-again/1504501200|accessdate=5 September 2017|series=The Alan Brazil Sports Breakfast|title=Monday, September 4, 2017|first=Joey|last=Barton}} On 6 August 2017, Pennington made his Leeds United debut in the 3–2 victory against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]], he picked up an ankle injury in the match and had to be replaced by fellow debutant [[Conor Shaughnessy]] in the 2nd half.{{cite web|url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/22152/report-bolton-wanderers-2-3-leeds-united|title=REPORT: BOLTON WANDERERS 2–3 LEEDS UNITED|publisher=Leeds United F.C.|date=6 August 2017}} He was unavailable until the latter half of September, when he returned to the bench.{{Cite news|url=https://www.footballinsider247.com/close-christiansen-delivers-fitness-update-leeds-united-duo/|title=Leeds United news: Pennington and Cooper set to return v Ipswich|date=18 September 2017|website=Football Insider|access-date=14 November 2017}} In October, following inconsistent results for the team, Pennington returned intermittently to the starting eleven. After 24 appearances, on 18 May 2018, Leeds announced Pennington would be returning to his parent club upon the expiry of his loan.{{cite news|newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=18 May 2018|title=LEEDS UNITED 2018/19 RETAINED LIST |url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/team-news/23386/leeds-united-2018-19-retained-list}} ====Return to Everton==== He returned to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] to play in the 2018/19 pre season under their new Manager [[Marco Silva]], on 11 May 2018 Pennington signed a new long term contract at the club keeping him there until the end of the 2021 season.{{cite news|newspaper=BBC Sport|date=11 May 2018|accessdate=3 August 2018|title=Matthew Pennington signs new contract at Everton until 2021|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44088619}} ====Ipswich Town (loan)==== On 31 August 2018, Pennington joined [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/08/31/pennington-joins-ipswich-on-loan|title=Pennington joins Ipswich on loan|publisher=Everton F.C.}} He scored his first goal for the club in a 2-2 draw against [[Birmingham City]] on 29 September 2018, however he was later sent off in the same match.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45609718|title=Birmingham 2-2 Ipswich Town |publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=1 October 2018}} ==International career== Pennington made his debut for [[England national under-19 football team|England U19s]] on 21 March 2013, coming on as a 70th-minute substitute in a 1–0 win over [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u19s/News/2013/turkey-report-210313|title=TheFA.com – Report: England U19s 1–0 Turkey U19s|publisher=The Football Association}} He was selected by [[Noel Blake]] after a performance against Arsenal in the [[FA Youth Cup]], where he played at right back, a position he had only figured in a few times in his career at the time.{{cn|date=July 2017}} {{Use American English|date=December 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Antonee Robinson | image = Antonee Robinson USA v COL 2018 (45272402752) (cropped).jpg | fullname = Antonee Robinson{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 11, 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|8|8}}{{cite web | title = Antonee Robinson | url = https://www.11v11.com/players/antonee-robinson-253799/ | publisher = 11v11 | accessdate = September 10, 2017}} | birth_place = [[Milton Keynes]], England | height = {{convert|1.83|m|order=flip}} | position = [[Left back]] | currentclub = [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 3 | youthyears1 = 2008–2015 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | years1 = 2015– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017–2018 | clubs2 = → [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps2 = 30 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps3 = 18 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1 = [[United States men's national under-18 soccer team|United States U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2018– | nationalteam2 = [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | pcupdate = 14:55, March 18, 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = October 16, 2018 }} '''Antonee Robinson''' (born August 8, 1997) is an American footballer currently playing for [[Wigan Athletic]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]] as a [[left back]]. ==Career== ===Everton=== Born in [[Milton Keynes]], England, Robinson came through Everton's [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|academy]], having been with the academy since the age of 11.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/a/ar/antonee-robinson|title=Antonee Robinson|publisher=Everton Official Site|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} In June 2013, he signed a scholarships with the club, becoming a full-time player.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2013/06/29/14-become-scholars|title=14 Become Scholars|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 29, 2013|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180112194918/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2013/06/29/14-become-scholars|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} While at the U18's side, however, Robinson suffered injuries that saw him sidelined most of the time and appeared for the U21 towards the end of the 2014–15 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/26/thorniley-wins-top-prize-at-academy-awards|title=Thorniley Takes Top Academy Prize|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=May 26, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150920085615/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/26/thorniley-wins-top-prize-at-academy-awards|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} As a result, he was awarded the club's Under-18 Players' Player of the Season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/05/robinson-pleased-with-recognition|title=Robinson Pleased With Recognition|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 5, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180214203032/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/05/robinson-pleased-with-recognition|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2014–15 season, he signed his first professional contract with the club after being offered a new contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/10/club-submits-retained-list|title=Club Submits Retained List|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 10, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825210345/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/10/club-submits-retained-list|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/03/grant-pens-new-deal|title=Grant Pens New Deal|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 3, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924040604/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/03/grant-pens-new-deal|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} However, Robinson spent the most of the 2015–16 season sidelined on the cartilage under his kneecap, resulting in him having an operation.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/29/next-generation-whos-next|title=Next Generation: Who's Next?|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=May 29, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825212413/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/29/next-generation-whos-next|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Despite this, he signed a one-year contract extension on July 15, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/07/15/new-deals-for-charsley-and-robinson|title=Charsley & Robinson Extend Deals|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 15, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825212604/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/07/15/new-deals-for-charsley-and-robinson|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Robinson then played all three matches in the [[EFL Trophy]], which saw [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton U23s]] eliminated in the Group stage. He also became a regular for the U23 side.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2016-2017/football-league-trophy/cheltenham-town|title=Robinson Targets Trophy Progress|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180214212355/http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2016-2017/football-league-trophy/cheltenham-town|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, Robinson signed a two-year contract extension with the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/06/robinson-signs-contract-extension|title=New Deal For Young Blues Defender|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 6, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170709005741/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/06/robinson-signs-contract-extension|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} ===Bolton Wanderers (Loan)=== On August 4, 2017, it was announced that Antonee Robinson had signed on loan at [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] until January.{{cite web|url=https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/august/wanderers-sign-premier-league-starlet-on-loan/|title=Wanderers sign Antonee Robinson on loan|publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C.|date=August 4, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170805060157/https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/august/wanderers-sign-premier-league-starlet-on-loan/|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Five days after joining the club, he made his debut in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] win at [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] on August 9, 2017, in a 2–1 win.{{cite news|title=Crewe Alexandra 1 – 2 Bolton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40798476|publisher=BBC Sport|date=August 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} Two weeks later, on August 22, 2017, he set up a goal for [[Jem Karacan]] to score the club's third goal of the game, in a 3–2 win over [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] in the League Cup.{{cite news|title=Bolton Wanderers 3 – 2 Sheffield Wednesday|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40932011|publisher=BBC Sport|date=August 22, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} It wasn't until on September 9, 2017 when he made his league debut for the side, starting the whole game, in a 3–0 loss against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news|title=Bolton Wandrers 0 – 3 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41132802|publisher=BBC Sport|date=September 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} Robinson then established himself in the left-back position, beating off competition from [[Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986)|Andrew Taylor]].{{cite news|title=Dynamic Everton full-back Antonee Robinson can be out of this world for Bolton Wanderers, says Phil Parkinson|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/15636276.Dynamic_Everton_loanee_Robinson_can_be_out_of_this_world/|publisher=The Bolton News|date=November 5, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} It was then announced on January 5, 2018 that Robinson had agreed to stay the remainder of the season at Bolton Wanderers.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/01/05/robinson-bolton-loan-extended|title=Robinson's Bolton Loan Extended|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=January 5, 2018|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180108174846/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/01/05/robinson-bolton-loan-extended|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Robinson then played a role in two separate matches; [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] and [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]]; assisting the only goal in the game with a win, which saw them push the side out of the relegation zone.{{cite news|title=Sheffield United 0 – 1 Bolton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42463021|publisher=BBC Sport|date=December 30, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}}
{{cite news|title=Bolton Wanderers 1 – 0 Bristol City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42827859|publisher=BBC Sport|date=February 2, 2018|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} ===International career=== Robinson is eligible for both England and the USA, having been born in England to an American father from [[White Plains, New York]].{{cite web|url=http://americansoccernow.com/articles/antonee-robinson-making-most-of-loan-to-bolton|title=Antonee Robinson Making Most of Loan to Bolton|publisher=American Soccer Now|accessdate=November 26, 2017}} He has been capped at under-18 level with the USA,{{cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2014/12/19/14/22/141219-u18mnt-falls-to-germany-in-spain|title=U.S. U-18 MNT FALLS TO GERMANY 3–2 IN MARBELLA, SPAIN|publisher=U.S. Soccer|accessdate=August 10, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://lionofviennasuite.sbnation.com/2017/8/4/16095540/done-deal-bolton-wanderers-complete-loan-signing-of-everton-defender-usa-efl-epl|title=Done Deal: Bolton Wanderers complete loan signing of Everton defender|publisher=SB Nation|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} During the match, he played in the center-back position instead of his natural position.{{cite news|title=Everton loanee Antonee Robinson out to teach Bolton Wanderers a few new tricks|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/15460535.Everton_loanee_Robinson_out_to_teach_Wanderers_a_few_new_tricks/|publisher=The Bolton News|date=August 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} He has also been called into the USA under-20 side.{{cite web|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2017/03/29/report-everton-take-jurgen-klinsmanns-son-jonathan-on-trial/|title=Report: Everton take Jurgen Klinsmann's son, Jonathan, on trial as Antonee Robinson attracts interest|publisher=HITC|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} On May 28, 2018 he made his full [[USMNT]] debut playing the full 90 minutes vs Bolivia.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/united-states/660/blog/post/3511977/antonee-robinson-excels-in-us-debut-as-americans-breeze-past-bolivia|title=Antonee Robinson excels in U.S. debut as Americans breeze past Bolivia|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=May 29, 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played November 10, 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Callum Connolly | image = | caption = | fullname = Callum Alexander Connolly{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1997|09|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Liverpool]], England | height = {{convert|1.85|m|order=flip}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 17 | youthyears1 = 2006–2016 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton]] | years1 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2016 | clubs2 = → [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] (loan) | caps2 = 3 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017 | clubs3 = → [[Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps3 = 17 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps4 = 34 | goals4 = 4 | years5 = 2018–2019 | clubs5 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps5 = 9 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2019- | clubs6 = → [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps6 = 1 | goals6 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 9 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | nationalyears3 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 10 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 7 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2018– | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 4 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | club-update = 23:09, 20 October 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 09:49, 14 July 2018 (UTC) }} '''Callum Alexander Connolly''' (born 23 September 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]]. His versatility means he can also play anywhere across the back four of defence and in midfield. ==Career== Connolly began his career at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and has earned representation at [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17]] and [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] level.{{cite news|last1=Kirkbride|first1=Phil|title=Everton youngster Callum Connolly cuts holiday short to prepare for new season|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-youngster-callum-connolly-cuts-9582572|accessdate=25 March 2016|work=Liverpool Echo|date=3 July 2015}} On 3 March 2016, he joined [[Football League One|League One]] side [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on a one-month loan deal.{{cite news|title=Everton defender Callum Connolly joins Barnsley on one-month loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35717908|accessdate=25 March 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=3 March 2016}} He made his debut two days later, in a 3–1 win over [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] at the [[Bescot Stadium]].{{cite news|title=Walsall 1 – 3 Barnsley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35675595|accessdate=25 March 2016|work=BBC Sport|date=5 March 2016}} Connolly made his first Everton teamsheet on 16 April 2016, when he was named as a substitute for the 1–1 draw with Southampton, coming on as a second-half substitute for injured right-back [[Seamus Coleman]] to make his Premier League debut.{{cite news|title=Everton debutants revel in 'dream come true' moment|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-debutants-revel-dream-come-11197134|accessdate=20 April 2016|work=Liverpool Echo|date=16 April 2016}} On 14 January 2017, Connolly signed on loan for [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] until the end of the season,{{cite news|title=CALLUM CONNOLLY SIGNS ON LOAN FOR WIGAN ATHLETIC|url=http://www.wiganlatics.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/callum-connolly-signs-for-wigan-athletic-3516926.aspx|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=Wigan Athletic|date=14 January 2017}} and just hours later made his debut and scored both goals as Wigan beat [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] 2–0.{{cite news|title=Burton Albion 0–2 Wigan Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38539037|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2017}} For the 2017-2018 season, Connolly played on loan for [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in the [[EFL Championship]]. Used largely in central midfield for the first time in his career,https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/evertons-callum-connolly-tough-successful-14373121 Connolly returned to Everton at the end of the season, having played an impressive 36 matches, scoring four goals.http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/06/12/connolly-ready-to-hit-ground-running At the beginning of the [[2018–19 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2018–19]] season Connolly re-joined [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on loan, initially for the whole of the season{{cite web |title=Callum Connolly: Everton youngster joins Wigan on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45130345 |website=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 August 2018}} but on 31 January 2019 he was recalled by Everton and sent on loan for the second half of the season to [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]]{{cite web |title=Callum Connolly: Everton youngster leaves Wigan to join Bolton on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47081594 |website=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 February 2019}} ==International career== Connolly received his first international call up when he was named in the [[England national under-17 football team|England under-17 squad]] for the [[2014 Algarve U17 International Tournament|2014 Algarve Tournament]].{{cite news|title=ENGLAND U17 SQUAD NAMED FOR ALGARVE TOURNAMENT|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/Feb/07/england-u17-squad-named-for-algarve-tournament-070214|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=7 February 2014}} Connolly made his debut against eventual winners [[Germany national under-17 football team|Germany]] in the final group stage game, with England finishing runners-up in the tournament.{{cite news|title=ENGLAND UNDER-17 SUFFER LATE HEARTBREAK IN THE ALGARVE|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/Mar/02/england-u17s-v-germany-algarve-tournament-match-report-020314|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=2 March 2014}} 10 days later, he was named in the squad for the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship elite round|elite round]] of qualification for the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]],{{cite news|title=ENGLAND U17 SQUAD ANNOUNCED FOR ELITE ROUND|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/Mar/12/england-u17-squad-named-for-elite-round-120314|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=12 March 2014}} and helped England qualify by starting the wins against [[Czech Republic national under-17 football team|Czech Republic]] and [[Italy national under-17 football team|Italy]].{{cite news|title=ARMSTRONG AND SOLANKE FIRE ENGLAND U17S INTO EURO FINALS|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/Mar/31/italy-v-england-u17-report|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=31 March 2014}} Connolly was not named in the squad for the final tournament, which England went on to win after beating the Netherlands on penalties in the final.{{cite news|title=England win European Under-17 Championship on penalties|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27512259|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=21 May 2014}} Connolly was part of the England squad for the [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]], and started the first game, a 2–1 win against [[France national under-19 football team|France]].{{cite news|title=England hold off France fightback |url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000598/match=2019792/postmatch/index.html|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=UEFA|date=12 July 2016}} However, he sustained an injury in the second half of the match, and withdrew from the squad six days later.{{cite news|title=CALLUM CONNOLLY WITHDRAWN FROM ENGLAND UNDER-19S SQUAD|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/Jul/18/callum-connolly-withdrawn-from-squad-180716|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=The FA|date=18 July 2016}} After also beating the [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands]]{{cite news|title=England pip Netherlands in added time|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000598/match=2019796/index.html|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=UEFA|date=15 July 2016}} and [[Croatia national under-19 football team|Croatia]]{{cite news|title=England finish group stage with third straight win|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000598/match=2019799/index.html|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=UEFA|date=18 July 2016}} to top the group, England were eventually eliminated in the semi-finals against [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy]].{{cite news|title=Italy down England with Dimarco double|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/matches/round=2000599/match=2020324/index.html|accessdate=14 January 2017|work=UEFA|date=21 July 2016}} Connolly was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40158560 |title=England Under-20s: Is this the country's next golden generation?|first= Jack |last=Skelton|work=BBC Sport |date=11 June 2017 }} He played in the opening match against Argentina and the second against Guinea,{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/may/22/callum-connolly-guinea-world-cup-preview-220517 |title=Callum Connolly believes England's long-term planning for U20 World Cup is paying off |work=The FA |date= 22 May 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/watch-evertons-england-world-cup-13172233 |title=Watch Everton's England World Cup winners enjoy post-match piley-on! |first= David |last=Prentice|date=12 June 2017|work=Liverpool Echo }} but was unused as a substitute in the final that England won, their first win in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory of 1966.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 }} Connolly played in four of the five matches as the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] won the [[2018 Toulon Tournament]], including scoring against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]] in the semi-final. ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 30 May 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+
